district 1 wards 12 james r behrend alderperson district 2 wards 34 jackie valde alderperson district 3 wards 78 wayne f dehn alderperson district 4 wards 56 matt grimmer alderperson district 5 wards 910 kevin maples alderperson district 6 wards 1112 tim aicher alderperson district 7 wards 1314 common council ____________ michelle luedtke city clerk city officials ____________ kent attwell mayor ____________ doug saloga alderperson district 1 wards 12 james r behrend alderperson district 2 wards 34 jackie valde alderperson district 3 wards 78 wayne f dehn alderperson district 4 wards 56 matt grimmer alderperson district 5 wards 910 phil kasun alderperson district 6 wards 1112 tim aicher alderperson district 7 wards 1314 common council ____________ michelle luedtke city clerk preface this a republication of the general and permanent ordinances of the city of delafield wisconsin source materials used in the preparation of the republication were the 1997 as supplemented  and ordinances subsequently adopted by the city council the source of each section is included in the history note appearing in parentheses at the end thereof the absence of such a note indicates that the section is new and was adopted for the first time with the adoption of the use of the comparative tables appearing in the back of this the reader can locate any section of the 1997 as supplemented and any subsequent ordinance included herein the chapters of the been conveniently arranged in alphabetical order and the various sections within each chapter have been catchlined to facilitate usage notes which tie related sections of the which refer to relevant state law have been included a table listing the state law citations and setting forth their location within the included at the back of this system the chapter and section numbering system used in this the same system used in many state and local government codes each section number consists of two parts separated by a dash the figure before the dash refers to the chapter number and the figure after the dash refers to the position of the section within the chapter thus the second section of chapter 1 is numbered 12 and the first section of chapter 6 is 61 under this system each section is identified with its chapter and at the same time new sections can be inserted in their proper place by using the decimal system for amendments for example if new material consisting of one section that would logically come between sections 61 and 62 is desired to be added such new section would be numbered 615 new articles and new divisions may be included in the same way or in the case of articles may be placed at the end of the chapter embracing the subject and in the case of divisions may be placed at the end of the article embracing the subject the next successive number shall be assigned to the new article or division new chapters may be included by using one of the reserved chapter numbers care should be taken that the alphabetical arrangement of chapters is maintained when including new chapters page numbering system the page numbering system used in this a prefix system the letters to the left of the colon are an abbreviation which represents a certain portion of the volume the number to the right of the colon represents the number of the page in that portion in the case of a chapter of the the number to the left of the colon indicates the number of the chapter in the case of an appendix to the the letter immediately to the left of the colon indicates the letter of the appendix the following are typical parts of codes of ordinances which may or may not appear in this this time and their corresponding prefixes charter cht1 charter comparative table chtct1 code cd code appendix cda1 code comparative tables cct1 state law reference table slt1 charter index chti1 code index cdi1 index the index has been prepared with the greatest of care each particular item has been placed under several headings some of which are couched in lay phraseology others in legal terminology and still others in language generally used by local government officials and employees there are numerous cross references within the index itself which stand as guideposts to direct the user to the particular item in which the user is interested looseleaf supplements a special feature of this publication is the looseleaf system of binding and supplemental servicing of the publication with this system the publication will be kept up to date subsequent amendatory legislation will be properly edited and the affected page or pages will be reprinted these new pages will be distributed to holders of copies of the publication with instructions for the manner of inserting the new pages and deleting the obsolete pages keeping this publication up to date at all times will depend largely upon the holder of the publication as revised pages are received it will then become the responsibility of the holder to have the amendments inserted according to the attached instructions it is strongly recommended by the publisher that all such amendments be inserted immediately upon receipt to avoid misplacing them and in addition that all deleted pages be saved and filed for historical reference purposes acknowledgments this publication was under the direct supervision of beth tattershall editor of the municipal tallahassee florida credit is gratefully given to the other members of the publishers staff for their sincere interest and able assistance throughout the project the publisher is most grateful to jeanne obrien deputy clerktreasurer for her cooperation and assistance during the progress of the work on this publication it is hoped that her efforts and those of the publisher have resulted in a ordinances which will make the active law of the city readily accessible to all citizens and which will be a valuable tool in the daytoday administration of the citys affairs copyright all editorial enhancements of this copyrighted by municipal the city of delafield wisconsin editorial enhancements include but are not limited to organization  table of contents  section catchlines  prechapter section analyses  editors notes  cross references  state law references  numbering system  code comparative table  state law reference table  and index such material may not be used or reproduced for commercial purposes without the express written consent of municipal the city of delafield wisconsin  copyrighted material municipal the city of delafield wisconsin 2018 state of wisconsin city of delafield aukesha county ordinance no 770 an ordinance adopting and enacting a new code for the city of delafield  providing for the repeal of certain ordinances not included therein  providing a penalty for the violation thereof  providing for the manner of amending such code  and providing when such code and this ordinance shall become effective whereas the the municipal the city of delafield published by municipal consisting of chapters 1 each inclusive is adopted whereas all ordinances of a general and permanent nature enacted on or before  and not included in the recognized and continued in force by reference therein are repealed whereas the repeal provided shall not be construed to revive any ordinance or part thereof that has been repealed by a subsequent ordinance that is repealed by this ordinance whereas unless another penalty is expressly provided every person convicted of a violation of any provision of the any ordinance rule or regulation adopted or issued in pursuance thereof shall be punished as follows 1 first offense any person who shall violate any provision of this upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $500 nor more than $50000 but not more than the forfeiture permitted by statute together with the costs of prosecution and in default of payment of such forfeiture and costs of prosecution shall be imprisoned in the county jail until such forfeiture and costs are paid but not exceeding 90 days 2 second offense any person found guilty of violating any ordinance or part of an ordinance of this has previously been convicted of a violation of the same ordinance within one year shall upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $1000 nor more than $50000 but not more than the forfeiture permitted by statute for each such offense together with the costs of prosecution and in default of payment of such forfeiture and costs shall be imprisoned in the county jail until such forfeiture and costs are paid but not exceeding 90 days each act of violation and each day upon which any such violation shall continue or occur shall constitute a separate offense the penalty provided by this section unless another penalty is expressly provided shall apply to the amendment of any whether or not such penalty is reenacted in the amendatory ordinance in addition to the penalty prescribed above the city may pursue other remedies such as abatement of nuisances injunctive relief and revocation of licenses or permits whereas additions or amendments to the passed in such form as to indicate the intention of the city to make the same a part of the be deemed to be incorporated in the so that reference to the the additions and amendments whereas ordinances adopted after  that amend or refer to ordinances that have been codified in the be construed as if they amend or refer to like provisions of the therefore the mayor and common council of the city of delafield wisconsin adopt the municipal code and enact a new code for the city of delafield effective  passed and adopted this 15th day of june 2020 city of delafield by___________ kent attwell mayor attested ___________ michelle luedtke city of delafield clerk general provisions rules of construction in the construction of this general ordinances the following rules shall be observed unless such construction would be inconsistent with the manifest intent of the ordinance 1 wisconsin statutes all references to wisconsin statutes or wis stats mean the current edition of the wisconsin statutes and includes the most recent biennial session 2 gender singular and plural every word in this in any ordinance imparting the masculine gender may extend and be applied to females as well as males and every word imparting the singular number only may extend and be applied to several persons or things as well as to one person or thing  provided these rules of construction shall not be applied to any provision which contains any express language excluding such construction or when the subject matter or context of such provision may be repugnant thereto 3 person the word person extends and applies to natural persons firms corporations associations partnerships or other bodies politic and all entities capable of being sued unless plainly inapplicable 4 acts of agents when a provision requires an act to be done which may by law as well be done by an agent as by the principal such requirement shall be construed to include all such acts when done by an authorized agent 01 conflict and separability a conflict of provisions if the provisions of the different chapters of this with or contravene each other the provisions of each chapter shall prevail as to all matters and questions arising out of the subject matter of such chapter b separability of if any section subsection sentence clause or phrase of the for any reason held to be invalid or unconstitutional by reason of any decision of any court of competent jurisdiction such decision shall not affect the validity of any other section subsection sentence clause or phrase or portion thereof the council hereby declares that they would have passed this each section subsection sentence clause phrase or portion thereof irrespective of the fact that any one or more sections subsections sentences clauses phrases or portions may be declared invalid or unconstitutional 02 clerk to file documents incorporated by reference whenever in this standard code rule regulation or other written or printed matter is adopted by reference it shall be deemed incorporated in this if fully set forth herein and the clerk shall file deposit and keep in his office a copy of the code standard rule regulation or other written or printed matter as adopted materials so filed deposited and kept shall be public records open for examination with proper care by any person during the clerks office hours subject to such orders or regulations which the clerk may prescribe for their preservation 03 penalty provisions a general penalty except as otherwise provided any person who shall violate any of the provisions of this upon conviction of such violation be subject to a penalty which shall be as follows 1 first offense any person who shall violate any provision of this upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $500 nor more than $50000 but not more than the forfeiture permitted by statute together with the costs of prosecution and in default of payment of such forfeiture and costs of prosecution shall be imprisoned in the county jail until such forfeiture and costs are paid but not exceeding 90 days 2 second offense any person found guilty of violating any ordinance or part of an ordinance of this has previously been convicted of a violation of the same ordinance within one year shall upon conviction thereof forfeit not less than $1000 nor more than $50000 but not more than the forfeiture permitted by statute for each such offense together with the costs of prosecution and in default of payment of such forfeiture and costs shall be imprisoned in the county jail until such forfeiture and costs are paid but not exceeding 90 days b continued violations each violation and each day a violation continues or occurs shall constitute a separate offense nothing in this preclude the city from maintaining any appropriate action to prevent or remove a violation of any provision of this c execution against defendants property whenever any person fails to pay any forfeiture and costs of prosecution upon the order of any court for violation of any ordinance of the city the court may in lieu of ordering imprisonment of the defendant or after the defendant has been released from custody issue an execution against the property of the defendant for such forfeiture and costs 04 repeal of general ordinances all ordinances heretofore adopted by the city council are hereby repealed except all ordinances or parts of ordinances relating to the following subjects and not conflicting with any of the provisions of this 1 the issuance of corporate bonds and notes of the city of whatever name or description 2 the establishment of grades curb lines and widths of sidewalks in the public streets and alleys 3 the fixing of salaries of public officials and employees 4 rights licenses or franchises or the creation of any contract with the city 5 the lighting of streets and alleys 6 the annexation of territory to the city 7 the naming and changing of names of streets alleys public grounds and parks 8 the letting of contracts without bids 9 the establishment of aldermanic districts aldermanic district boundaries and election precincts 10 tax and special assessment levies 11 releases of persons firms or corporations from liability 12 construction of public works 13 water sewer and electric rates rules and regulations and sewer and water main construction 14 budget ordinances resolutions and actions 05 effect of repeals the repeal or amendment of any section or provision of this of any other ordinance or resolution of the council shall not 1 by implication be deemed to revive any ordinance not in force or existing at the time such repeal or amendment takes effect 2 affect any vested right privilege obligation or liability acquired accrued or incurred under any enactment so repealed or amended unless the privilege of repealing such obligation or privilege has been reserved by the city 3 affect any offense committed or penalty or forfeiture incurred previous to the time when any ordinance is repealed or amended  except when any forfeiture or penalty has been mitigated by the provisions of any ordinance such provisions shall apply to and control any judgment to be pronounced after such ordinance takes effect for any offense committed before that time 4 affect any prosecution for any offense or the levy of any penalty or forfeiture pending at the time when any ordinance aforesaid is repealed or amended  but the right of action shall continue and the offender shall be subject to the penalty as provided in such ordinance and such prosecution shall proceed in all respects as if such ordinance had not been repealed  except all such proceedings had after the time this effect shall be conducted according to the provisions of this 06 title  effective date citation these ordinances shall be known as the municipal the city of delafield and shall take effect from and after passage and publication as provided in wis stats   all references thereto shall be cited by section number example section 506 municipal the city of delafield 07 keeping code current  revisors amendments as each ordinance or resolution affecting the municipal effective the city clerk shall forward such ordinance or resolution to the revisor who shall incorporate them into the municipal revisor shall make no substantive changes to such ordinances and resolutions but may renumber rearrange and edit them without first submitting them to the city clerk  and such rearranging renumbering and editing shall not affect the validity of such ordinances and resolutions or the provisions of this municipal thereby 08 administration article i  in general secs 21218  reserved article ii  general government division 1  generally form of government the city of delafield shall be organized and governed under the provisions of wis stats ch 62 01  rep & recr #694  elected officials a officials the elective officers of the city shall be a mayor municipal judge and one alderman from each aldermanic district b eligibility no person shall be elected to a city office who is not at the time of his election 18 years of age a citizen of the united states and of the state and an elector of the city and if an aldermanic district office of the aldermanic district and actually residing therein 02 appointed officials the following shall be appointed officials official how appointed term administrator mayor subj to conf by the council indefinite chief of police police comm indefinite city assessor mayor subj to conf by the council 2 yrs commencing may 1 even years city attorney mayor subj to conf by the council 2 yrs city engineer mayor subj to conf by the council 2 yrs commencing may 1 even years city clerk mayor subj to conf by the council 2 yrs commencing may 1 even years electrical inspector mayor subj to conf by the council if not a city employee the inspector shall enter into a contract with the city 2 yrs emergency government dir mayor subj to conf by the council 2 yrs fire chief fire comm indefinite plumbinghvac inspector mayor subj to conf by the council if not a city employee the inspector shall enter into a contract with the city 2 yrs treasurer mayor subj to conf by the council 2 yrs commencing on may 1 even years official building inspector mayor subj to conf by the council if not a city employee the inspector shall enter into a contract with the city 2 yrs 03  rep & recr 694  oaths and bonds elected and appointed officials shall take and file the official oath within ten days after notice of their election or appointment as provided in wis stats  62094a and shall execute and file the official bond as required by state statutes and this municipal 04 removals a elected officials elected officials may be removed by the city council as provided in wis stats  17121a or 1716 b appointed officials appointed officials may be removed as provided in wis stats  17121c and 1716 05 vacancies a how occurring vacancies in elective and appointive positions are caused as provided in wis stats  1703 and  b how filled vacancies in elective and appointive offices shall be filled as provided in wis stats  1723 06 salaries the salaries of all elected and appointed officials including members of boards and commissions shall be as determined by the city council from time to time provided the salary of the mayor and members of the council shall not be increased during their terms of office see wis stats  2 07  rep & recr #694  receipt of gifts and gratuities a restricted no city employee or official shall receive or offer to receive either directly or indirectly any gift gratuity or other thing of value which he is not authorized by ordinance or state statute to receive from any person who 1 has or is seeking to obtain contractual or other business or financial relationships with the city or city council  or 2 conducts operations or activities which are regulated by the city or city council  or 3 has interests which may be substantially affected by the city or city council b penalty the receipt of any gift gratuity or other thing of value as denoted above is contrary to the public policy of the city and is punishable as provided in wis stats  94612 such conduct shall also be punishable under section 14 08 defense of officers a by city attorney the city council may authorize the city attorney to defend actions brought against any officer or employee of the city or of any board or commission of the city growing out of any acts done in the course of his employment or out of any alleged breach of his duty as such officer or employee this section is discretionary the provisions of wis stats   are incorporated herein by reference b by private counsel the city council may authorize special counsel privately retained by the officer or employee of the city or of any board or commission of the city to defend actions brought against the officer or employee growing out of any acts done in the course of his employment or out of any alleged breach of his duty as such officer or employee the officer or employee is required to submit the name of the special counsel that the officer or employee wishes to retain and a written fee agreement no fees or other costs of defense of any officer or employee of the city or of any board or commission of the city shall be paid by the city unless the name of the special counsel and the fee arrangement have been submitted to and approved by council resolution 09  cr #315 secs 228257  reserved division 2  officials mayor and alderpersons a election and term 1 the mayor and alderpersons from aldermanic districts 2 4 and 6 shall be elected during evennumbered years the alderpersons from aldermanic districts 1 3 5 and 7 shall be elected during oddnumbered years see charter  2 except as otherwise specifically provided the regular term of the mayor and alderperson shall be two years b duties and powers 1 mayor see wis stats  62098 2 city council the alderpersons shall constitute the city council and shall have such duties and powers as are enumerated in wis stats ch 62 and elsewhere in the statutes 3 police powers see section 2622 c authority the city council shall have all powers of the city not specifically given to some other body or officer except as otherwise provided by law the city council shall have the management and control of the city property finances highways streets utilities and the public service and may act for the government and good order of the city for its commercial benefit and for the health safety welfare and convenience of the public and may carry its powers into effect by license regulations suppression borrowing taxation special assessment appropriation imposition of forfeiture and other necessary or convenient means the city council may appoint such officers from time to time as may be deemed necessary for the benefit of the community the powers hereby conferred shall be in addition to all other grants and shall be limited only by express language 10  am #296  am #373  rep & recr #694  assessor a appointment and term see section 221 b applicable statute see wis stats  6209 c duties and powers 1 statutes see wis stats  7012 7013 7017 7018 7023 7029 7030 7032 7034  7035  7043 7044 7045 7048 7049 7050  and  in particular 2 other duties prescribed law the assessor shall perform such other duties as shall be prescribed by state law supervisory personnel of the state department of revenue and the city council including attendance at all meetings of the board of review 11  rep & recr #694  municipal judge and municipal court a municipal judge 1 office created pursuant to wis stats  75501 there is created the office of municipal judge for the city 2 election  term the municipal judge shall be elected at large at the spring election in evennumbered years for a term of four years or until a successor is elected and qualifies commencing on may 1 next succeeding his election 3 salary the municipal judge shall receive a salary as determined from time to time by the city council which shall be in lieu of fees and costs no salary shall be paid to the judge for any time during his term for which he has not executed and filed his official bond and oath as required by subsection a4 of this section 4 bond  oath a the municipal judge shall execute and file with the clerk of the courts for waukesha county the oath prescribed by wis stats  75702 and a bond in the penal sum of $50000 b the municipal judge shall not be qualified to act until a certified copy of the bond is filed with the city clerk and a certified copy of the oath is filed with the office of the state administrator of courts as required by wis stats  75503 5 jurisdiction the municipal judge shall have jurisdiction as provided by law and wis stats   and exclusive jurisdiction of violations of city ordinances resolutions and bylaws 6 appointment of clerks deputy clerks the municipal judge shall in writing appoint such clerks and deputy clerks as are authorized by the council or board their salaries shall be fixed by the council or board as provided in wis stats  75510 b municipal court 1 court established the municipal court for the city of delafield is established pursuant to wis stats  755011 and ch 755 2 hours the municipal court for the city shall be open as determined by order of the municipal judge 3 location the municipal judge shall keep his office and hold court in the city hall 4 collection and return of forfeitures the municipal judge shall collect all forfeitures penalty assessments fees and taxable costs in any action or proceeding before him and shall pay over such moneys to the city treasurer within seven days of collection at such time the municipal judge shall also report to the city treasurer the title nature of offenses and total amount of judgments imposed in actions and proceedings in which such moneys were collected 5 contempt of court a the municipal judge after affording an opportunity to the person accused to be heard in defense may punish for contempt of municipal court persons guilty of either of the following acts 1 disorderly contemptuous and insolent behavior toward the judge while engaged in any judicial proceeding or other conduct which tends to interrupt the proceedings or to impair the respect due the judges authority 2 resistance of or disobedience to any lawful order or process made or issued by the judge b for the purpose of hearing the persons defense the municipal judge may if the alleged offender is not present issue a warrant for the person to be brought before the municipal judge c the municipal judge may upon finding any person guilty of contempt order such person to forfeit not more than $5000 plus a penalty assessment under wis stats  75705 upon nonpayment of the forfeiture and penalty the person found guilty of contempt may be sentenced to the county jail not to exceed seven days c stipulations and deposits in municipal court 1 deposit schedule to be established the municipal judge shall establish and submit to the city council for approval in accordance with wis stats   a schedule of deposits for violations of city ordinances resolutions and bylaws except traffic regulations which are governed by wis stats  34527 and boating violations governed by wis stats  2367 when approved by the council such deposit schedule shall be posted in the office of the municipal court clerk and the city police department 2 stipulation and deposit in lieu of court appearance persons cited for violations of city ordinances resolutions or bylaws for which a deposit has been established under this subsection shall be permitted to make a stipulation of no contest and a deposit in lieu of court appearance as provided in wis stats    and 80009 3 traffic and boating deposits the deposit schedule established by the wisconsin judicial conference and the procedures set forth in wis stats chs 23 and 345 shall apply to stipulations and deposits for violations of traffic regulations enacted in accordance with wis stats  34527 and boating regulations enacted in accordance with wis stats  3077 4 when not permitted stipulations and deposits shall not be permitted after initial appearance or in cases of contempt under subsection b5 of this section 12  rep & recr #694  city attorney a appointment and term see section 221 b applicable statute see wis stats  620912 13 electrical inspector see section 883 14 plumbing inspector see section 854  city engineer a appointment and term see section 221 b duties and powers the city engineer shall perform such duties and have such powers as are provided by state statute and this municipal as shall be prescribed from time to time by the mayor or the city council c compensation the office of city engineer shall be compensated on a feeforservice basis only at a rate to be agreed upon from time to time 15 clerk a appointment and term see section 221 b duties the clerk shall perform those duties prescribed in wis stats  620911 and such other duties as the council may prescribe c deputy the clerk may in writing filed with the mayor and in the office of the clerk appoint a deputy who shall act under the clerks direction and in the clerks absence or disability or in case of a vacancy shall perform the clerks duties and shall have power to administer oaths and affirmations the deputy shall receive such compensation as the council shall provide the clerk and the clerks sureties shall be liable on the clerks official bond for the acts of such deputy 16  am ch #331 editors note charter adopted oct 1 200 provided for the combining of the offices of clerk and treasurer appointment to be made by the mayor subject to confirmation of the common council director of public works the city administrator shall serve as director of public works 17  cr #694  chief of police a appointment and term see section 221 b duties and powers see wis stats  620913 18 fire chief appointment and term see chapter 18 of the municipal 19  rep & recr 694  treasurer a appointment and term see section 221 b duties the treasurer shall perform those duties prescribed in wis stats  62099 and such other duties as the council may prescribe the treasurer shall be the investment officer for the city c deputy the treasurer may in writing filed with the mayor and in the office of the clerk appoint a deputy who shall act under the treasurers direction and in the treasurers absence or disability or in case of a vacancy shall perform the treasurers duties the deputy shall receive such compensation as the council shall provide the acts of such deputy shall be covered by official bond as the council shall direct   am ch #331 editors note charter adopted oct 1 200 provided for the combining of the offices of clerk and treasurer appointment to be made by the mayor subject to confirmation of the common council city administrator a creation there is hereby created the office of city administrator the offices of city administrator and director of public works may be held by the same person that person to be called city administratordirector of public works b appointment and term see section 221 c duties the administrative duties and responsibilities of the city administrator shall be prescribed from time to time by the mayor and the council provided these duties do not usurp the duties or functions that are required by state law to be performed by the city boards commissions and other city officers or department officials the administrator shall have the following specific duties and responsibilities 1 effectuate all actions of the council which require administrative implementation 2 direct coordinate and expedite the activities of all city departments except where such authority is vested by state law in officers boards and commissions such responsibilities shall include making or directing such studies as are necessary to determine or bring about the most economical efficient operation of such departments and their programs as deemed necessary however the administrator shall not control the activities within the various departments such functional departmental activities to remain under the direct control of the department heads 3 direct and control organizational channels the efficient performance of all city employees duties after the appropriate screening and selection process has been followed the administrator shall submit recommendations to the mayor and council for appointees to vacancies in any city positions for offices of the city not required by law or ordinance to be otherwise selected 4 develop budgeting procedures and prepare or supervise the preparation of the annual operating budget the administrator shall also be responsible for coordinating financial and economic data for the citys longrange financial plans in addition the administrator shall make such reports as the mayor and the council require as to the current status of budgeted items and shall review and report to the mayor and council any variations in the operation of the city budget 5 serve as personnel officer for the city and be responsible for the development and administration of standardized personnel policies and procedures subject to council approval and in accordance with all prior ordinances relating to tenure of certain city positions  conduct labor negotiations with union representatives 6 develop and implement standardized purchasing policy and procedure for the city the administrator is responsible for supervising the purchasing of all supplies materials and equipment 7 review proposed and pending county state and federal legislation and report to the mayor and council on its effect upon the city in addition the administrator shall appear on the citys behalf at all legislative and administrative hearings as directed by the mayor or the council 8 submit when necessary recommendations and suggestions for improving the health safety or welfare of the residents of the city and coordinate a system of communications among and with the mayor and the council as well as with the general public this shall include the establishment of procedures for the facilitation of the communications between citizens and the city to assure that complaints grievances recommendations and other matters receive the prompt attention of a responsible official and are expeditiously resolved 9 keep informed concerning current developments in the field of municipal administration and the availability of state and federal funds for local purposes 10 work closely with all department heads to ensure that they and other city employees receive adequate opportunities for training within budget allowances prescribed by the council to improve their knowledge and skills the administrator shall act as the approving authority for all requests by city employees to attend conferences meetings training schools etc pertaining to their employment 11 in coordination with the mayor and the city clerk prepare the agenda for all meetings of the council together with such supporting data as may be required provided nothing herein shall be construed to give the administrator authority to limit or prevent matters from being considered by the council the administrator shall assist the mayor and the city clerk as required in the performance of their duties 12 shall attend all meetings of the council assisting the mayor and the city clerk as required in the performance of their duties  attends meetings of boards and commissions as necessary and desired 13 negotiate manage and monitor a wide variety of city contracts with other governmental bodies and private vendors that provide service to city residents and customers 14 serve as city liaison to a number of regional boards commissions agencies and districts that provide services directly or indirectly to the city  creates and negotiates intergovernmental agreements for consideration by and approval of the city council 15 manage a variety of special projects  serve as liaison with property owners residents contractors engineers and regulatory agencies 16 apply for state and federal grants for the city alone or in conjunction with other governmental jurisdictions 17 provide effective and efficient customer services and promote and maintain responsive community relations 18 act as press officer for the city and be the spokesperson on all matters within hisher authority to assure that news media are kept fully informed and that all open meeting rules and regulations are followed 19 assist in the preparation of ordinances and resolutions as requested by the mayor or the council as needed d under delafield the administrator is hereby designated the administrative officer under the direction of the plan commission the administrator may delegate certain administrative inspection and enforcement responsibilities to the building inspector or other city employees or independent contractors subject to approval by the plan commission e the city of delafield organizational chart designated as appendix a and on file in the office of the city clerk shall hereby be adopted and established as the official organizational chart for the city of delafield absent statutory conflicts to the contrary this chart shall establish the chain of command throughout the organization   cr ch #331  cr #410  cr #585  am #585  rep & recr #694  director of tourism promotion and economic development a office created the office of tourism promotion and economic development is hereby created the city promotion and tourism commission commission shall appoint a director of tourism promotion and economic development b duties the office of tourism promotion and economic development shall serve as a tourism entity and shall be responsible for performing those duties and obligations imposed upon a tourism entity as described in wis stats   the director shall coordinate and expedite tourism promotion and economic development activities within the city and shall perform such other duties as the city promotion and tourism commission may authorize and direct c budget the director shall after giving due consideration to the anticipated tax revenues to be collected by the city under section 463 room tax formulate and submit an annual budget pursuant to the financial policies and procedures of the city funding for the office shall be exclusively from room tax proceeds the city shall not budget or make payments in excess of the room tax collected under section 463 no expenditure exceeding the budget approved by the council shall be made without an appropriate fund transfer approved by the city council   cr # 734    1 2 8202018 secs 2722100  reserved division 3  boards commissions and departments city plan commission a how constituted the city plan commission shall consist of the mayor who shall be its presiding officer one alderperson and six citizen members the chairperson or designee of the lake welfare committee and park and recreation commission shall be appointed as citizen members together with four additional citizen members the plan commission shall at all times consist of eight members members shall for cause be removable by the city council b appointment and term 1 citizen members citizen members shall be persons of recognized experience and qualifications 2 appointment citizen members shall be appointed by the mayor annually in april for staggered threeyear terms subject to confirmation by city council 3 alderperson member annually during the month of april the alderperson member of the plan commission shall be appointed by the mayor and subject to confirmation by the city council c powers and duties the authority of the city plan commission and its functions and duties shall be as set forth in wis stats  6223 20  am #558  am #599  rep & recr #694  park and recreation commission a composition the park and recreation commission shall consist of seven members one member shall be a city alderman selected annually by majority vote of the city council to serve for a oneyear term to begin on may 1 the six citizen members shall be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by a majority of the members of the city council members of the park and recreation commission shall be qualified residents of the city b terms each citizen member shall serve a threeyear term the terms to be staggered by the appointment of two citizen members each year so as to provide continuity of membership c organization 1 officers the commission members shall annually elect for oneyear terms to begin in may a chairman a vicechairman and a secretary 2 vacancies any vacancies occurring on the park and recreation commission shall be filled by appointment by the mayor subject to confirmation by the city council such appointees shall serve the balance of the term of the member replaced d duties and powers 1 buying selling and letting the park and recreation commission shall have the power to purchase lease sell or exchange park or recreation lands facilities and equipment subject to approval of the city council 2 acquisition by other means the commission shall have the power to acquire any park or recreation lands facilities and equipment by gift devise bequest or condemnation either absolutely or in trust  money real or personal property or any incorporeal right or privilege subject to the approval of the city council 3 control and management the commission shall have the power to govern manage control improve develop maintain and operate all city parks or recreational lands facilities equipment and activities and to adopt necessary rules and regulations for such purposes 4 tree board the commission shall also serve as the citys tree board as required to meet the arbor day foundations tree city usa standards the commission shall be charged with developing and administering a comprehensive tree management program the commission shall be responsible for writing and implementing an annual community forestry work plan the commission shall also have all powers and duties enumerated in wis stats  2709 5 other duties the commission shall have such additional powers and duties as shall be assigned by the city council in addition to all powers enumerated in wis stats  2708 e finances the commission shall submit to the city administrator by august 1 of each year a proposed program and budget for the ensuing year the commission shall not contract any liability in excess of the budget appropriated unless specifically authorized by the city council all monies received for the purposes of the commission whether from the general fund or from approved donations or from such reasonable fees as may be charged for activities facilities or services shall be deposited in the general fund of the city and segregated on the books of the city the city treasurer shall act as treasurer of the commission without additional compensation 21  am #282  am #559  cr # 687  zoning board of appeals a how constituted the city zoning board of appeals shall consist of five members to be appointed by the mayor subject to confirmation by the city council members shall be appointed to staggered threeyear terms with one or two members to be appointed each year in addition the mayor shall appoint two alternate members of the board of appeals who shall act with full power only when a member of the board refuses to vote because of interest or when a regular member is absent any vacancy occurring on the board shall be filled for the unexpired term of the member involved by appointment and confirmation as stipulated for fullterm appointments members shall be removable for cause as provided by law b powers and duties the zoning board of appeals shall have the power to adopt rules  meet and hear and determine appeals as prescribed by law  and shall have all of the powers conferred or conferrable thereon by the provisions of any statute law rule or provision of this existing or hereafter created including but not limited to the power in appropriate cases and subject to appropriate conditions and safeguards to make special exceptions to the terms of the zoning of any other zoning provisions hereafter adopted in harmony with the general purposes and intent of such regulations and in accordance with general or specific rules therein contained such exceptions or variances may be granted upon determination by the board that the variance shall not be contrary to the public interest where owing to special conditions a literal enforcement of the terms of the zoning result in practical difficulty or unnecessary hardship so that the spirit of the regulations shall be observed public safety and welfare secured and substantial justice done see wis stats  62237e 22 water pollution control commission see section 503 24 police commission a creation the police commission shall consist of five citizens three of whom shall constitute a quorum the mayor shall annually between the last monday of april and the first monday of may appoint in writing to be filed with the secretary of the commission one member for a fiveyear term the initial appointments shall be of the required five commissioners each for varying terms from one to five years all appointments shall be subject to confirmation by the council no appointment shall be made which will result in more than three members of the commission belonging to the same political party b ex officio alderman member in addition to the members provided in subsection a of this section the mayor shall appoint for a term of one year subject to confirmation by the council one alderman to serve with the commission as an ex officio nonvoting member c duties the police commission shall perform such duties as are prescribed in wis stats  6213 d rules the police commission shall keep a record of its proceedings and shall adopt rules and regulations necessary to carry out its duties 25  rep & recr #625 public works committee a public works committee the department of public works shall operate within the authority of the public works committee as granted by the city council the public works committee shall be comprised of seven members to include one member of the city council serving a oneyear term renewable annually  and six citizen members serving threeyear terms appointments shall be made by the mayor with approval of the city council b duties the department of public works shall be responsible for the maintenance repair and construction of all city bridges buildings grounds public rightsofway as well as repair and maintenance of city sanitary sewers and equipment pertinent to its functions c administration the city administrator shall administer the department of public works 26  rep & recr #694  board of review a composition the board of review shall consist of the mayor the president of the common council and five citizen members who shall be appointed by the mayor to serve a term of two years subject to confirmation by the common council in addition the mayor shall appoint two alternate members to the board of review who shall serve a term of two years and whose appointment shall be subject to confirmation by the common council one alternate member shall be designated as the first alternate and the other as being the second alternate alternate members when required shall act with full power when a member of the board of review refuses to vote because of conflict of interest is absent or if a person who is objecting to a valuation requests the removal of a board of review member pursuant to the provisions of wis stats  70476m or is otherwise unavailable to hear an objection the mayor and common council president shall receive no additional compensation for service on the board of review but citizen members and alternate members shall be compensated at a rate of $4000 per meeting or such other compensation as may be determined annually by the common council the mayor or in the absence of the mayor the president of the common council shall chair the board of review b duties  wisconsin statutes adopted by reference the duties and functions of the board of review shall be as prescribed in wis stats  7046 7047 and 7048 which sections of the wisconsin statutes are hereby adopted by reference c confidentiality of information about income and expenses whenever the assessor in the performance of the assessors duties requests or obtains income and expense information pursuant to wis stats  70477af or any successor statute thereto then such income and expense information that is provided to the assessor shall be held by the assessor on a confidential basis except however that the information may be released to and used by persons  in the discharging of duties imposed by law  in the discharge of duties imposed by office including not limited to use by the assessor in performance of official duties of the assessors office and used by the board of review in performance of its official duties or pursuant to order of a court income and expense information provided to the assessor under wis stats  70477af unless a court determines that it is inaccurate is not per wis stats  70477af subject to the right of inspection or copying under wis stats  19351 d hearing procedure in accordance with the provisions of wis stats  70478 the board of review is authorized to consider requests and objections from property owners or the property owners representatives to offer testimony under oath by telephone or submit written statements under oath to the board of review the following procedure shall apply to such requests 1 a property owner or property owners representative may request that the board of review consider testimony offered under oath by telephone or consider written statements submitted under oath provided that a the requirements of wis stats  7047 which requires that the property owner or property owners representative provide notice of intent to appear at the board of review hearing are satisfied  and b the objection form for real estate property assessment pa115a has been completed and submitted to the board of review in accordance with the provisions of wis stats  7047  and c a request to testify by telephone or submit a written statement under oath to the board of review form pa814 shall be filed with the city clerk such requests must be submitted timely to be considered by the board of review at the first meeting of the board of review 2 criteria to be considered the board of review may consider any and all of the following factors when deciding whether to grant or deny a request established under this subsection a the requesters stated reasons for the request as indicated on the pa814 b fairness to the parties c ability of the requester to procure in person oral testimony and any due diligence exhibited by the requester in procuring such testimony d ability to crossexamine the person providing the testimony e the board of reviews technical capacity to honor the request f any other factors that the board deems pertinent to deciding the request 27  cr #433  cr #464  cr #715   rep & recr # 736  lake welfare committee a committee created a committee to represent the city of delafield such committee shall be known as the lake welfare committee hereafter called the committee pursuant to wis stats  62115 the purpose of this committee is to study problems and issues relating to nagawicka lake upper nashotah lake and the bark river within the city limits and make recommendations to the common council concerning solutions thereto b membership 1 number of members the committee shall consist of 11 members as follows one member of the common council one representative from the village of nashotah and nine city of delafield citizen members 2 selection all members shall be appointed by the mayor with approval of the common council 3 term of office the representative of the common council and the representative from the village of nashotah shall serve one year terms those citizen members from the oddnumbered aldermanic districts shall serve twoyear terms to expire in the oddnumbered years and those citizen members from evennumbered aldermanic districts shall serve twoyear terms that expire in the evennumbered years 4 citizen member citizen members shall represent as closely as possible the seven aldermanic districts 5 removal any member of the committee may only be removed by a majority vote of the common council 6 vacancies vacancies shall be filled by appointment of the mayor with approval of the common council each successor so selected shall serve the remaining term of the member whose office has been vacated c officers 1 officers designated the officers of the committee shall be a chair and a vicechair in addition the committee may choose to appoint a clerk 2 selection and term of office each committee officer shall be elected annually by the committee members at the june meeting and shall serve a oneyear term 3 removal any officer may be removed by a majority vote of the committee 4 vacancies any vacancy of office shall be filled by the committee at its next meeting following the vacancy d meetings 1 regular meetings the committee shall meet once a month or additionally as needed 2 annual lake awareness meeting the committee shall have an annual lake awareness meeting each year e powers and duties the committee shall be responsible for investigating any and all issues and concerns that arise regarding nagawicka lake upper nashotah lake and the bark river within the city limits and make recommendations to the common council concerning solutions thereto 29  cr #573  rep & recr #694    1 11182019   1 12020 library board the library board shall be appointed pursuant to wis stats  43541 and 4360   rep & recr #647 deer management committee a committee created the common council has determined that a deer management committee shall be created to implement the deer management plan and policy approved by the common council the deer management committee shall be advisory to the common council b membership 1 number of members the deer management committee shall consist of seven members as follows one member of the common council one member from the public works committee one member from the park and recreation commission one member from the promotional and tourism council and three city citizen members 2 selection all members shall be appointed by the mayor with confirmation by a majority of the members of the common council 3 term of appointments the representative from the common council shall serve a oneyear term all other members shall serve staggered twoyear terms half of these initial appointments shall be oneyear terms to accomplish the staggering to provide continuity of membership with half of the terms expiring in even numbered years and half of the terms expiring in odd numbered years the terms of the public works committee member and two of the citizen members shall expire in even numbered years the terms of the park and recreation commission member the promotional and tourism council member and one of the citizen members shall expire in odd numbered years terms shall expire in april as part of the common council organizational meeting appointments following the spring election 4 removal members shall for cause be removable by a majority vote of the common council 5 vacancies vacancies shall be filled by appointment by the mayor with confirmation by a majority of the members of the common council each successor so elected shall serve the remaining term of the member they replaced 6 officers the officers of the deer management committee shall include a chair and a vicechair officers shall be elected annually following the april appointment by the committee members the chair shall work with city staff to coordinate meetings set the meeting agendas and packet documentation and shall preside over all meetings of the deer management committee when in attendance the vicechair shall fulfill the responsibilities of the chair when the chair is unavailable or absent any officer may be removed as an officer not as a committee member by a majority vote of the committee members officer vacancies shall be filled by the committee at its next meeting following the vacancy c termination of committee unless otherwise terminated by action of the common council adopted by a majority of the common in an amount determined by the city attorney or in the form of an irrevocable letter of credit from a recognized lending institution if such security is not filed the city council may reject the petition for annexation 31  #704  secs 21342164  reserved division 5  elections polling places the polling place for all aldermanic districts shall be located at christ the king lutheran church 1600 n genesee street 40  am #236  am #594 registration of electors a registry of electors shall be made for each aldermanic district applicable to regular special and primary elections 41 spring primary whenever three or more candidates file nomination papers for a city office the primary election to nominate candidates shall be held 42  cr ch #63 polling hours polls shall be open in the city from  am to  pm 43  cr #180 secs 21692189  reserved article iii  the governing body the city council the city council shall consist of the mayor and one alderperson from each aldermanic district who shall be elected for twoyear terms 01 meetings a regular meetings regular meetings of the city council shall be held at least once per month typically on the third monday of each calendar month by october 31 of each year the city council shall approve a schedule of city council meetings for the next year the city clerk shall publish this approved schedule on the citys website by november 15 of each year for months when a second city council meeting is scheduled it shall typically be scheduled for the first monday of the month city council meetings shall be held in the council chambers at city hall unless otherwise noted city council meetings shall begin at  pm unless otherwise noted and shall be open and public pursuant to wis stats ch 19 b special meetings special meetings of the city council may be called by the mayor or any two alderpersons with written notice filed with the clerk at least 24 hours prior to the time specified for such meeting the clerk shall notify each alderperson of the time and purpose of such meeting by telephone electronic mail andor causing a written notice thereof to be delivered to each alderperson special meetings may be held without such notice when all members of the city council are present in person or consent in writing to the holding of such meeting such written consent to be filed with the clerk prior to the beginning of the meeting any special meeting attended by all the alderpersons shall be a regular meeting for the transaction of any business that may come before such meeting c adjournments the council may by a majority vote of those present but not less than three affirmative votes adjourn from time to time to a specific date and hour 02  am #373  rep & recr #695    1 1072019 presiding officer a designated the mayor shall preside in the absence of the mayor the president of the council shall preside in the absence of both the mayor and the president the city clerk shall call the meeting to order and preside until the alderpersons present elect one of their number acting mayor for that meeting b duties the presiding officer shall preserve order and decorum decide all questions of order and conduct the proceedings of the meeting in accordance with the parliamentary rules contained in roberts rules of order newly revised unless otherwise provided by statute or by these rules c decisions appeals from any member may appeal from a decision of the presiding officer an appeal shall be sustained by a twothirds vote of the council 03  am #373 roll call  quorum a roll call  procedure when quorum not in attendance as soon as the council is called to order the city clerk shall proceed to call the names of the members noting who are present and who are absent and record the same in the proceedings of the council if there is not a quorum present the fact shall be entered in the minutes and the council may adjourn  or the mayor or in his absence the clerk may issue a process to any policeman commanding him forthwith to summon the absentees b quorum twothirds of the members shall be a quorum pursuant to wis stats  62113b the mayor shall not be counted in computing a quorum in determining a quorum of the council the term member shall mean those council members who have been duly elected or appointed for a current regular or unexpired term and whose service has not been terminated by death resignation or removal from office 04  rep & recr #695  order of business the business of the council shall be conducted in the following order 1 call common council meeting to order 2 pledge of allegiance 3 roll call 4 approve minutes 5 city of delafield citizens comments for items not on the agenda city of delafield citizens comments for items on the agenda 6 consent agenda 7 committee reports report on discussion and action taken at previous meetings future agenda items and upcoming scheduled meetings a licenses b plan commission c lake welfare committee d park and recreation commission e public works committee f delhart commission g police commission h library board i board of zoning j promotional and tourism committee k lake country fire commission l lake country fire board 8 unfinished business 9 mayors report 10 new business 11 reports of city officials a administrator b clerktreasurer c council requests for future agenda items no discussion of requested items 12 correspondence 13 adjourn 05  rep & recr #695  clerk pro tem in the absence of the clerk the mayor shall appoint a clerk pro tem 06  am #373 mayor to conduct the mayor at the stated hour shall call the meeting to order he shall preserve order and decorum decide all questions of order and conduct the proceedings of the meeting in accordance with the parliamentary rules contained in roberts rules of order newly revised unless otherwise provided by statute or by these rules any member shall have the right of appeal from a decision of the presiding officer the appeal may be sustained by a majority of the members present exclusive of the presiding officer 07 president to conduct in absence of mayor if the mayor is absent at the designated time of any meeting the president of the council shall preside and during the absence or inability of the mayor shall have the powers and duties of the mayor excepting that he shall not have the power to approve an act of the council which the mayor has disapproved by filing an objection with the clerk he shall when so officiating be styled acting mayor the president shall be selected by a twothirds vote of all members of the council at the annual organizational meeting on the third tuesday of april in the absence of both the mayor and the president of the council the clerk shall call the meeting to order and preside until the council shall by motion select an acting mayor for that meeting 08  am #373 conduct of deliberations a presiding officer speaking whenever the presiding officer shall desire to speak upon any question or to make any motion he shall vacate the chair and designate the president of the council if present or any alderperson to preside temporarily b council may act as committee of the whole the mayor may declare the entire council a committee of the whole for informal discussion at any meeting or for any other purpose and shall ex officio be chairman of the same provided there is no objection by any one of the alderpersons present at the meeting c appointment of committees the mayor may from time to time appoint such special committee or committees as he may deem advisable or as provided for by motion or resolution stating the number of members and object thereof to perform such duties as may be assigned to them 09 consideration of matters before the council a reference to committee all ordinances resolutions communications and other matters submitted to the council shall be read by title and author and acted on by the council unless the council chooses to refer such matters to the appropriate committee for study and recommendation back to the council the clerk shall read and record each such reference by title any alderperson may require the reading in full of any matter at any time it is before the council b financial claims upon the city all bills and other financial claims against the city shall be itemized and upon receipt thereof shall be examined by the clerk and referred by the clerk to the next meeting of the council provided that payment of regular wages and salaries of officials and employees according to schedules adopted by the council shall be made by the clerk without submission to the council after verification and approval by the mayor c committee minutes required each committee shall at the next regular council meeting submit written minutes of all matters considered by it d committee may require conference when authorized by the council any committee may require any city official to confer with it and supply information needed in connection with any matter pending before the committee e action on matters discussed when a question is under discussion no action shall be in order except the following motions which shall have precedence in the order listed 1 to adjourn  2 to recess  3 to lay on the table  4 to move the previous question  5 to postpone to a certain day  6 to refer to a committee  7 to amend  or 8 to postpone indefinitely f termination of debate any member desiring to terminate debate may move the previous question in which event the presiding officer shall announce the question as shall the main question now be put if a majority of the members present vote in the affirmative the main question shall be taken without further debate its effect being to put an end to all debate and bring the council to a direct vote first upon any pending amendments and then upon the main question g vote may be demanded any alderperson may demand an aye and nay vote on any matter and such vote shall be entered in the proceedings on confirmation of appointments and on the adoption of any measure assessing or levying taxes appropriating or disbursing money or creating any liability or charge against the city or any fund thereof the vote shall be aye and nay every member shall vote when a question is put unless the council by a majority vote of those present excuses him for special cause a majority vote of all members of the council in favor of any proposed ordinance resolution or appointment shall be necessary for passage or approval unless a larger number is required by statute except as otherwise provided by these rules a majority vote of those present shall prevail in other cases h mayor to abstain the mayor shall not vote except in the case of a tie when the mayor does vote in the case of a tie his vote shall be counted in determining whether a sufficient number of council members has voted favorably or unfavorably on any measure a majority vote of all members of the council in favor of any proposed ordinance resolution or appointment shall be necessary for passage or approval unless a larger number is required by statute except as otherwise provided a majority vote of those present shall prevail in other cases i motion to adjourn a motion to adjourn shall always be in order  and a motion to adjourn to recess or to lay on the table and a call for the previous question shall be decided without debate j resolutions appropriating money or creating charges to the city all ordinances or resolutions appropriating money or creating any charge against the city other than the payment of claims for purchases or work previously authorized by the council shall not be finally acted upon by the council sooner than at the next regular meeting following their introduction provided that this provision may be suspended by affirmative action by threefourths of all members of the council 10  am #173  am #373 reconsideration of question any member voting with the majority may move for a reconsideration of the vote on any question at that meeting a motion to reconsider being put and lost shall not be renewed an alderperson may not change his vote on any question after the result has been announced 11 disturbances and disorderly conduct whenever any disturbance or disorderly conduct occurs in any meeting of the council the presiding officer may cause the room to be cleared of all persons guilty of such disorderly conduct except the alderpersons if any alderperson is guilty of disorderly conduct the presiding officer may order the police to take himher into custody for the time being or until the meeting adjourns such member may appeal from such order to the council as in other cases 13  am #373 appropriations and accounts all demands or accounts shall be acted upon at the time of presentation unless one or more members demands a reference 14 publication and effect of ordinances a publication all general ordinances of the city and all regulations imposing a penalty or a summary of the general ordinance or regulation as permitted by wis stats  62114c1 shall be published in the official newspaper of the city as a class 1 notice under wis stats ch 985 and shall be immediately recorded by the city clerk in a book kept for that purpose affidavits of publication shall be filed separately a printed copy of such ordinance or resolution in any book pamphlet or newspaper and published or purporting to be published therein by direction of the city council shall be prima facie proof of due passage publication and recording thereof b effective date unless otherwise provided all ordinances shall take effect and be in force from and after passage and publication  and published copies thereof shall have appended the date of first publication 16  am #373  am #592 amendment of rules these rules shall not be rescinded or amended unless the proposed amendment or motion to rescind has laid over from a regular meeting and then it shall require a vote of twothirds of all the members of the council 17 suspension of rules these rules or any part thereof may be temporarily suspended in connection with any matter under consideration by a recorded vote of the members present 18 secs 22062233  reserved article iv  finance fiscal year the calendar year shall be the fiscal year 02 budget a departmental estimates annually on or before october 1 each officer or department shall file with the finance officerbudget analyst an itemized statement of disbursements made to carry out the powers and duties of the officer or department during the preceding fiscal year a detailed statement of the receipts and disbursements on account of any special fund under the supervision of the officer or department during the year and of the condition and management of the fund and detailed estimates of the same matters for the current fiscal year and for the ensuing fiscal year such statements which shall be designated as departmental estimates shall be presented in the form prescribed by the finance officerbudget analyst such form to be as nearly uniform as possible for the main division of all departments b budget preparation 1 finance officerbudget analyst to submit estimates the finance officerbudget analyst shall submit all departmental estimates to the city administrator who shall be responsible for the preparation of the annual budget per section 270c4 2 information required the budget shall include the following information a the expense of conducting each department and activity of the city for the ensuing fiscal year and corresponding items for the current year and last preceding fiscal year with reasons for increase and decrease recommended as compared with appropriations for the current year b an itemization of all anticipated income of the city from sources other than general property taxes and bonds issued with a statement comparing the amounts received by the city from each of the same or similar sources for the last preceding and current fiscal year c an itemization of the amount of money to be raised from general property taxes which with income from other sources will be necessary to meet the proposed expenditures d such other information as may be required by the council and by state law 3 copies required the city shall provide a reasonable number of copies of the budget thus prepared for distribution to citizens c notice and hearing the council shall hold a public hearing on the budget after giving notice thereof as required by wis stats  6590 d action by council following the public hearing the proposed budget may be changed or amended and shall take the same course in the council as ordinances 03  rep & recr #696  changes in budget the amount of the tax to be levied or certified and the amounts of the various appropriations and the purposes thereof shall not be changed after approval of the budget except by a twothirds vote of all the members of the city council notice of such change shall be given by publication within 15 days thereafter in the official city newspaper 04 city funds to be spent in accordance with appropriations no money shall be drawn from the city treasury nor shall any obligation for the expenditure of money be incurred except in pursuance of the annual appropriation in the adopted budget or when changed as authorized by section 2236 at the close of each fiscal year any unencumbered balance of an appropriation shall revert to the general fund and shall be subject to reappropriation  but appropriations may be made by the council to be paid out of the income of the current year in furtherance of improvements or other objects or works which will not be completed within such year and any such appropriation shall continue in force until the purpose for which it was made has been accomplished or abandoned excess funds from certain designated departments shall revert to their special reserve accounts as specified from time to time by the council 05 claims procedure a claims all claims and demands against the city shall be itemized and filed with the department heads who shall deliver the same to the finance officerbudget analyst for examination the finance officerbudget analyst shall thereafter examine such claim semimonthly and return the same to the clerktreasurer with the treasurers report thereon in writing who shall place the same before the council for action at its next meeting b claims to be verified all accounts demands or claims against the city shall be verified by the claimant or proper official c payment of regular wages or salaries payment of regular wages or salary pursuant to the budget and salary schedule adopted by the council may be by payroll verified by the proper official and filed in time for payment on the regular payday 06  am #373  rep & recr #696  public records a declaration of policy a representative government is dependent upon an informed electorate and therefore it is declared to be the public policy of the city of delafield that all persons are entitled to the greatest possible information regarding the affairs of their government and the official acts of those officers and employees who represent them further providing persons with such information is an essential function of a representative government and an integral part of the routine duties of officers and employees whose responsibility it is to provide such information to that end this article shall be construed in every instance with a presumption of complete public access consistent with the conduct of governmental business the denial of public access generally is contrary to the public interest and only in an exceptional case may access be denied therefore the city of delafield does hereby adopt and incorporate as though fully set forth herein the provisions of wisconsins public records laws wis stats  19311939 inclusive of all future amendments and revisions to such sections of the wisconsin statutes the following provisions are intended to supplement not to replace or to supplant the wisconsin public records laws b records custodians 1 designation of records custodians and alternate custodians custodian means that officer department head of the city of delafield who is designated by the mayor or by the terms of this article to keep and preserve public records or whom is required by law to file deposit or keep such public record in hisher office or is lawfully in possession or lawfully entitled to possession of public records the city clerktreasurer is the legal custodian of the records of the common council as a body politic and for all common council boards committees and commissions each alderperson shall be the custodian of their individual official records such as their correspondence memorandums and email any alderperson may designate in writing the city clerktreasurer to act as the official custodian of the alderpersons individual official records for every department the department head is the custodian of records for their agency every custodian of records shall designate in writing one or more employees to act in his or her absence as an alternate custodian of such records 2 duties custodians are vested with full legal power to render decisions and carry out the duties of the city under this article each custodian shall establish a procedure for handling records and shall see that all of their employees entrusted with records are informed of these procedures if a custodian has any question about granting or denying a request to inspect or copy any record he or she may consult with the city attorney 3 public records training each custodian and alternate custodian shall receive training regarding public records laws as soon as practicable upon receiving these duties custodians and alternate custodians are personally responsible for keeping current with any developments or advancements in records keeping and the wisconsin public records laws c procedural information 1 form of request the wisconsin public records law dictates that certain actions must be taken with regards to oral requests for records and that certain more formal actions are taken in response to written requests for records however the state law does not expressly state how to respond to the following methods of communication therefore requests made by the following means shall be responded to as follows a email a request made by email may be responded to via email or in writing and shall have all of the formalities as though the request was made in writing b voicemail a request made by voicemail shall be responded to as though it were made orally c instant messagingtext messaging a request made in either such manner shall be treated as
