location size and invert elevation of any existing or proposed sanitary or storm sewers culverts and drain pipes telephone poles and the location and size of any existing or proposed water and gas mains within the exterior boundaries of the plat or immediately adjacent thereto if there are no sewers or water mains located on or immediately adjacent to the plat the nearest of such sewers or water mains shall be indicated by their direction and distance from the plat with their invert elevations 20 locations of all existing property boundary lines streams and water courses marshes rock outcrops wooded areas and other similar significant features within the tract being subdivided or immediately adjacent thereto 21 location width and names of all proposed streets and public rightsofway such as alleys and easements 22 approximate dimensions of all lots together with the proposed lot and block numbers 23 location and approximate area of any sites to be reserved or dedicated and the conditions if any of such reservation or dedication for parks playgrounds drainageways or other public use or which are to be used for group housing shopping centers church sites or other nonpublic uses not requiring designation by lot number 24 proposed building lines 25 approximate radii of all curves and length of tangents 26 existing zoning within and adjacent to the proposed subdivision 34  rep & recr #441  rep & recr # 720  street plans and profiles a the city engineer may require that the subdivider provide street plans and profiles showing existing ground surface proposed and established street grades including extension for a reasonable distance beyond the limits of the proposed subdivision when requested b all elevations shall be based upon usgs datum and plans and profiles shall meet the approval of the city engineer 35  rep & recr #441 testing a the city engineer may require that borings and soundings be made in specified areas to ascertain subsurface soil rock and water conditions including depth to bedrock and depth to ground water table b where the subdivision will not be served by public sanitary sewer service the provisions of wis admin h65 shall be complied with  and the appropriate data submitted with the preliminary plat 36  rep & recr #441 covenants the plan commission may require submission of a draft of protective covenants whereby the subdivider intends to regulate land use in the proposed subdivision and otherwise protect the proposed development 37  rep & recr #441 affidavit by surveyor the surveyor preparing the preliminary plat shall certify on the face of the plat that it is a correct representation of all existing land divisions and features and that he has fully complied with the provisions of this chapter 38  rep & recr #441 secs 449644118  reserved article iv  final plat general a final plat prepared by a registered land surveyor shall be required for all subdivisions it shall comply in all respects with the requirements of wis stats  23620 which section is incorporated in this chapter by reference and article ii of this chapter all elevations referred to in such section shall be referred to usgs datum and bearings referenced to the wisconsin state plane coordinate system 39  rep & recr #441  rep & recr # 720  additional information the plat shall show correctly on its face in addition to the information required by said wis stats  23620 the following 1 exact length and bearing of the centerline of all streets 2 railroad rightsofway within and abutting the plat 3 setbacks or building lines required by the plan commission 4 all lands reserved for future public acquisition or reserved for the common use of property owners within the plat 5 special restrictions required by the plan commission relating to access control along public ways or to the provision of planting strips 40  rep & recr #441 deed restrictions the plan commission may require the deed restrictions be filed with the final plat 41  rep & recr #441 surveying and monuments all final plats shall meet all the surveying and monumenting requirements of wis stats  23615 the city engineer shall examine all final plats and make field checks and generally review the plat to determine whether the final plat meets all of the requirements of this chapter and the appropriate sections of the wisconsin statutes 42  rep & recr #441 certificates all final plats shall provide all of the certificates required by wis stats  23621  and in addition the surveyor shall certify that he has fully complied with all of the provisions of this chapter 43  rep & recr #441 secs 4412444144  reserved article v  certified survey map general a certified survey map prepared by a registered land surveyor shall be required for all minor subdivisions it shall comply in all respects with the requirements of wis stats  23634 and article ii of this chapter 44  rep & recr #441  rep & recr #646 additional information the certified survey map shall show correctly on its face in addition to the information required by said wis stats  23634 the following 1 all existing buildings water courses drainage ditches and other features pertinent to proper division 2 setbacks or building lines required by the plan commission 3 all lands reserved for future acquisition 4 date of map graphic scale and names and addresses of the owner subdivider and surveyor 5 bearings must be referenced to the wisconsin state plane coordinate system 45  rep & recr #441  rep & recr # 720  certificates a the surveyor shall certify on the face of the certified survey map that he has fully complied with all of the provisions of this chapter and with the appropriate sections of the wisconsin statutes b after a recommendation by the city engineer and other reviewing agencies the common council shall certify its approval on the face of the map c dedication of streets and other public areas shall require the owners certificate and the mortgagees certificate in substantially the form as required by wis stats  236212a 46  rep & recr #441 recording the certified survey map shall be recorded by the city clerk with the county register of deeds only after the certificates of the common council and the surveyor are placed on the face of the map 47  rep & recr #441  rep & recr # 720  secs 4414944179  reserved article vi  design standards streets to be public a public street shall be provided for convenient access to all property within the subdivision and no private street or thoroughfare shall be permitted 48  rep & recr #441 street and trail arrangements a in any new subdivision the street layout and location of pedestrian bicycle and equestrian trails shall conform to the arrangement width and location indicated on the official map comprehensive plan or comprehensive plan components of the city the streets shall be developed and located in proper relation to 1 existing and proposed streets 2 topography 3 natural features such as streams and tree growth 4 public convenience and safety 5 proposed use of the land to be served by such streets 6 the most advantageous development of adjoining areas b arterial streets as hereafter defined shall provide 1 ready access to centers of employment and governmental activity community shopping areas recreation and points beyond the boundaries of the community 2 they shall be properly integrated with and related to the existing and proposed system of major streets and highways and shall be insofar as practicable continuous and in alignment with existing or planned streets with which they are to connect c collector streets as hereafter defined shall provide 1 ready collection of traffic from residential areas and conveyance of this traffic to the major street and highway system 2 shall be properly related to a the mass transportation system b special traffic generators such as schools churches and shopping centers and other concentrations of population c the major streets into which they feed d minor streets as hereafter defined shall be laid out to 1 conform to topography 2 discourage use by 3 permit the design of efficient storm and sanitary sewage systems 4 require the minimum street area necessary to provide safe and convenient access to abutting property e optional minor streets as hereafter defined are intended to 1 provide for a narrower pavement than the standard 27foot minor street pavement width 2 this cross section shall be permitted only with plan commission approval and may be used only where one or more of the following specific site conditions exist a extensive tree coverage that can be preserved b difficult topography for construction of the standard minor street c residential density of one or more acres per dwelling unit d provision for sidewalk or other pedestrian walkway facilities within the subdivision e preservation of a historical building or structure f proposed streets 1 proposed streets shall extend to the boundary lines of the tract being subdivided unless prevented by topography or other physical conditions or unless in the opinion of the plan commission such extension is not necessary or desirable for the coordination of the layout of the subdivision with the existing layout or the most advantageous future development of adjacent tracts 2 where the new subdivision connects with an existing subdivision which has culdesac streets which will connect to the streets in the proposed subdivision the developer will enter the existing subdivision remove the culdesac regrade seed the ditches and extend the existing street to connect with the proposed streets the removal of the culdesac and the extension of the existing street will conform to city street requirements g alleys 1 alleys shall be provided in commercial and industrial districts for offstreet loading and service access 2 the plan commission may waive this requirement where other provision for such loading and access shall be assured 3 alleys shall not be approved in residential areas unless necessary because of topography or other exceptional circumstances 4 deadend alleys are prohibited 5 alleys shall not connect to a major thoroughfare h arterial street and highway protection whenever the proposed subdivision contains or is adjacent to a major street or highway adequate protection of residential properties limitation of access and separation of local traffic shall be provided by reversed frontage with screen planting contained in a nonaccess reservation along the rear property line or by the use of frontage streets i reserve strips shall not be provided on any plat to control access to streets or alleys except where control of such strips is placed with the city under conditions approved by the plan commission j street names shall not duplicate or be similar to existing street names and existing street names shall be protected wherever possible 49  rep & recr #441  am #620 limited access highway and railroad rightofway treatment whenever the proposed subdivision contains or is adjacent to a limited access highway or railroad rightofway the design shall provide the following treatment 1 when lots back upon the rightofway of an existing or proposed limited access highway or railroad a planting strip at least 30 feet in depth shall be provided adjacent to the highway or railroad in addition to the normal lot depth 2 this strip shall be a part of the platted lot but shall have the following restriction lettered on the face of the plat this strip reserved for the planting of trees and shrubs the building of structures hereon prohibited 3 commercial and industrial districts shall have provided on each side of the limited access highway or railroad streets approximately parallel to and at a suitable distance from such highway or railroad but not less than 150 feet 50  rep & recr #441 street design standards the minimum rightofway and pavement width of all proposed streets alleys and trails shall be as specified on the comprehensive plan comprehensive plan component official map or neighborhood development study or if no width is specified therein the minimum widths shall be determined by the public works committee and approved by the city council as follows facility row width pavement width arterial boulevard streets 120 222 arterial streets 90 48 standard collector streets 66 36 rural collector streets 66 27 minor streets 60 27 optional minor streets 60 24 alleys 25 20 equestrian trails 12 na combined pedestrian and bicycle trails 20 10 pedestrian ways 10 5 1 arterial boulevard streets shall have two 22foot pavements separated by a 20foot median strip and a pavement consisting of five inches of compacted and watered threequarterinch crushed gravel and four inches of 1inch traffic bound crushed limestone base course and 4 inches of bituminous concrete surface 2 arterial streets shall have a pavement width of 48 feet and a pavement consisting of five inches of compacted and watered threequarterinch crushed gravel and four inches of 1inch traffic bound crushed limestone base course and 4 inches of bituminous concrete surface 3 standard collector streets shall have a pavement width of 36 feet and a pavement consisting of five inches of compacted and watered threequarterinch crushed gravel and four inches of 1inch traffic bound crushed limestone base course and four inches of bituminous concrete surface in areas where the projected average daily traffic adt is less than 3500 vehicles per day and the projected vehicle trip rates in the peak hour are less than 600 the city may designate rural collector streets which may have a pavement width of 27 feet instead of 36 feet in areas where the projected average daily traffic adt is less than 3500 vehicles per day and the projected vehicle trip rates in the peak hour are less than 600 the city may designate rural collector streets which may have a pavement width of 27 feet instead of 36 feet 4 minor streets shall have a pavement width of 27 feet and a pavement consisting of five inches of compacted and watered threequarterinch crushed gravel and four inches of 1inch traffic bound crushed limestone base course and four inches of bituminous concrete surface 5 optional minor streets shall have a pavement width of 24 feet and a pavement consisting of five inches of compacted and watered threequarterinch crushed gravel and four inches of 1inch traffic bound crushed limestone base course and four inches of bituminous concrete surface 6 culdesacs shall meet all of the requirements for a minor street and shall terminate in a circular turnaround having a minimum rightofway diameter of 120 feet a a circle with a minimum diameter of 80 feet shall be paved b when it is desired to leave a planting area in the center of the culdesac a minimum rightofway diameter of 150 feet and a minimum pavement width of 18 feet with a minimum centerline diameter of 90 feet shall be provided c a culdesac must be provided for any street designed to have one end permanently closed such street shall not exceed 400 feet in length any such street in excess of 400 feet shall require plan commission approval 7 alleys provided to serve business commercial or industrial uses shall be constructed in accordance with the specifications for collector streets provided that the surface shall be 20 feet 8 equestrian trails the surface shall be of such construction as may be approved by the city engineer 9 combined bicycle and pedestrian paths shall have a minimum eightfoot pavement width except where state or federal funding requires a higher standard 10 pedestrian ways shall have a minimum pavement width of five feet 11 minimum radius of 20 feet must be provided at all points where edges of various pavements as described above join and meet other newly constructed or existing pavements including all intersections and points where culdesac turnaround circles meet the entrance pavement 12 bituminous construction standard the bituminous concrete surface material described as a part of each pavement type shall be constructed in two lifts a the first or binder course lift shall consist of 2 inches of binder course the city engineer shall provide asphalt specifications b the second or surface lift shall consist of 1 inches of surface course and installed no sooner than eight months following installation of the binder course and no later than october 1 of the year following installation of the binder course or as specified in the developers agreement c the surface course shall be installed only after the binder course is thoroughly cleaned and swept and a tack coat for bonding purposes applied d prior to installation of the surface course the binder course shall be inspected by the city engineer and any distressed areas noted by the engineer shall be repaired in accordance with city of delafield specifications 13 typical street cross sections typical street cross sections on the pages a attached to the ordinance from which this section is derived shall govern the construction of the subdivision streets and trails under this chapter 51  rep & recr #441  am #562  am # 720  street grades a unless necessitated by exceptional topography and always subject to the approval of the plan commission the maximum centerline grade of any street or public way shall not exceed the following 1 arterial and collector streets six percent 2 all other streets alleys and pedestrian ways eight percent 3 in no event shall the grade of any street alley or pedestrian way be less than onehalf of one percent b street alley and pedestrian way grades shall be established wherever practicable so as to avoid excessive grading promiscuous removal of ground cover and tree growth and general leveling of the topography 52  rep & recr #441 horizontal curves a minimum sight distance with clear visibility measured along the centerline shall be provided of at least 300 feet on arterial streets 200 feet on collector streets and 120 feet on all other streets 53  rep & recr #441 vertical curves all changes in street grades shall be connected by vertical curves of a minimum length equivalent to 30 times the algebraic difference in the rate of grade for arterial and collector streets and 20 times this minimum for all other streets 54  rep & recr #441 tangents a tangent of at least 100 feet long shall be introduced between reverse curves on arterial and collector streets 55  rep & recr #441 halfstreets a where an existing dedicated or platted halfstreet is adjacent to the tract being subdivided the other half of the street shall be dedicated by the subdivider b the platting of halfstreets shall be avoided where possible 56  rep & recr #441 street intersections a streets shall intersect each other at as nearly right angles as topography and other limiting factors of good design permit b number of streets converging at one intersection shall be reduced to a minimum preferably not more than two c number of intersections along major streets and highways shall be held to a minimum and wherever practicable the distance between such intersections shall not be less than 1200 feet d property lines at street intersections when required by the plan commission shall be rounded with a minimum radius of 30 feet or of a greater radius when required by the plan commission e minor streets need not necessarily continue across arterial or collector streets but if the centerline of such minor streets approach the major streets from opposite sides within 125 feet of each other measured along the centerline of the arterial or collector street the location shall be so adjusted that the alignment across the major or collector street is continuous 57  rep & recr #441 blocks a the widths lengths and shapes of blocks shall be suited to the planned use of the land and the type of development contemplated but the length of any block in residential areas shall not exceed 1500 feet nor have less than sufficient width to provide for two tiers of lots of appropriate depth between street lines b pedestrian ways may be required by the plan commission near the center and entirely across any block over 900 feet in length to provide adequate pedestrian circulation or access to schools shopping centers churches transportation or other community facilities c parcels reserved or laid out for commercial or industrial use shall have a width and length adequate to provide for offstreet service and parking required by the use contemplated and the area zoning restrictions for such use 58  rep & recr #441 a the size shape and orientation of lots shall be appropriate for the location of the subdivision and for the type of development and use contemplated the lots shall be designed to provide an appropriate building site and a proper architectural setting for the buildings contemplated proposed building elevations for each site shall be submitted with street crosssections drainage erosion control and grading plans b side lot lines shall be substantially at right angles to straight street lines or radial to curved street lines on which the lots face c lot lines shall follow municipal boundary lines wherever possible rather than cross them d double frontage and reverse frontage lots shall be prohibited except where necessary to provide separation of residential developments from or to overcome specific disadvantages of topography and orientation e access every lot shall front or abut for a distance of at least 30 feet on a public street an access only to existing private drives or streets shall be permitted only with the approval of the plan commission and only when permitted by the zoning code the 30foot limitation set forth above shall not apply to flag lots flag lots shall have frontage on a public street not less than the lot width requirement for the zoning district in which the lot is located f right angles to each other shall be avoided whenever possible particularly in residential areas g flag lots shall be avoided whenever possible particularly in residential areas flag lots shall be prohibited unless the staff of the flag lot has street frontage not less than the lot width required in the zoning district in which the lot is located h area and dimensions of lots shall conform to the requirements of the zoning code 1 excessive depth in relation to width shall be avoided and a proportion of 2 to one shall normally be considered as a desirable maximum for lot widths of 100 feet or more 2 where a lot has a narrow strip of land as part of the lot not as an approved easement extending from the public road to the main part of the lot where the principal structure could lawfully be placed flag lot such a narrow portion staff of the flag lot shall not constitute frontage unless the narrow portion is as wide as the required lot width for the district in which such lot is located unless otherwise approved by the plan commission i subdivision into large parcels whenever a tract is subdivided into large parcels such parcels shall be arranged and dimensioned as to allow resubdivision of any such parcels into normal lots in accordance with the provisions of this chapter j depth of lots or parcels reserved or laid out for commercial or industrial use shall be adequate to provide for offstreet service and parking required by the use contemplated and by the area zoning restrictions for such use k corner lots for residential use shall have increased minimum corner side yard setback as required by applicable provisions of the zoning code l lands lying between the meander line and the waters edge and any otherwise unplattable lands which lie between a proposed subdivision and the waters edge shall be included as part of lots outlots or public dedications in any plat abutting a stream or lake all lands under option to the subdivider or to which he holds any interest that abut the proposed subdivision and a stream lake flowage or wetland shall also be included m water level in determining the minimum lot areas under this code 90 percent of the minimum lot area shall be at least two feet and 80 percent of the minimum lot area shall be at least three feet above the elevation of the 100year floodplain boundary 59  rep & recr #441  am # 720  building setback lines all building setback lines shall be controlled by the zoning code 60  rep & recr #441 easements a utility easements shall be provided at the rear of all lot lines and on side lot lines or cross lots where necessary or advisable such utility easements shall be at least ten feet wide and evidence shall be furnished the common council that easements to be incorporated on the plat or in deeds have been reviewed by the individual utility companies or the organization responsible for furnishing the service involved b drainage easements 1 where a subdivision is traversed by a watercourse drainageway channel or stream an adequate drainageway or easement shall be provided as may be required by the plan commission the location width alignment and improvement of such drainageway or easement shall be subject to the approval of the city engineer 2 parallel streets or parkways may be required in connection with such drainageway or easement 3 the watercourse drainageway channel or stream may be relocated so that adequate drainage will be assured 4 wherever possible it is desirable that the drainage be maintained by an open channel with landscaped banks and adequate width for maximum potential volume of flow 5 in all cases such watercourse shall be of a minimum width of the established twofoot high water mark or in the absence of such specification not less than 30 feet 61  rep & recr #441 waterway openings a waterway openings of all new bridges and culverts carrying arterial streets over perennial streams shall be adequate to accommodate the 50year recurrence interval flood flow with the upstream high water elevation not to exceed a level of two feet below the roadway elevation and the hydraulic head loss structure not to exceed 001 feet b waterway openings of all new bridges and culverts carrying minor streets over perennial streams shall be adequate to accommodate the tenyear recurrence interval flood flow with the upstream headwater elevation not to exceed a level of two feet below the roadway elevation and the hydraulic head loss structure not to exceed 001 feet c the combination of the waterway opening and the approach road elevations on the floodlands shall not increase the flood stages more than 001 feet upon the occurrence of the 100year recurrence interval flood d such bridges and culverts shall be so designed and constructed as to facilitate the passage of ice floes and other debris e any stream designed as navigable shall meet all applicable federal state and county requirements and regulations 62  rep & recr #441 public sites and open spaces a in the design of the plat proper consideration shall be given to the reservation of suitable sites of adequate area for future schools parks playgrounds drainageways and other public purposes b if such sites are not designated on the comprehensive plan as referred to in section 4415 consideration shall be given in the location of such sites to the preservation of scenic and historic sites stands of fine trees marshes lakes and ponds watercourses watersheds and ravines 63  rep & recr #441  am #620 acceptance of dedications and improvements a the approval of the final plat by the mayor and common council shall constitute acceptance of the dedication of the rightofway for any public street open space or other public area but the developer shall remain liable for any accidents on any such street open space or other public area prior to the time of final acceptance by the city of the street improvement b the acceptance of the improvements constructed shall be deemed to be made after successful completion of the guaranteed period covered by the guaranty bond and by formal resolution of the mayor and common council c the normal operating cost of the operation of such improvement shall be assumed by the city when put in operation and pending the final acceptance thereof 64  rep & recr #441 secs 4419744215  reserved article vii  required improvements survey monuments the subdivider or developer shall install survey monuments placed in accordance with wis stats  23615 and as may be required by the city engineer 65  rep & recr #441 procedure a after filing the preliminary plat or sooner if the subdivider or developer prefers two copies of construction plans and specifications prepared by a professional engineer registered in wisconsin shall be furnished for the following improvements where such improvements are required by this chapter or are to be installed voluntarily by the developer 1 streets and sidewalks 2 sanitary sewage system 3 storm drainage and storm sewers 4 water supply and distribution 5 public utility installations 6 street lights street signs street trees and the like 7 additional special plans or information as required by the plan commission and public works committee b the city engineer shall review or cause to be reviewed the construction plans and specifications for conformity with all applicable requirements and shall approve conditionally approve or reject in writing the proposed improvements before such improvements are commenced c upon such decision and recommendation by the city engineer the common council shall within 90 days after such recommendation grant approval conditionally approve or reject the proposed improvements and the subdivider or developer shall be notified in writing of the approval any conditions imposed or the reason for rejection 66  rep & recr #441 construction and inspection a construction of each phase shall not commence without 24hour notice to the city engineer this approval shall be conditioned upon the receipt of all necessary permits and the compliance with all construction methods specifications and design as required by this article b all construction of improvements required of the subdivider or developer must be completed within two years of the date of the approval of the preliminary plat by the plan commission unless good cause can be shown for granting of an extension of time by both the mayor and the common council c inspections shall be made at the start and during the course of construction as the city engineer deem necessary in order to ensure compliance with the plans and specifications as approved d the final plat shall not be approved or sureties or money deposits released until final inspection and approval by the city engineer of all completed work 67  rep & recr #441  am #562 grading after the installation of temporary block corner monuments by the subdivider or developer and the establishment of street grades by the city public works committee the subdivider shall grade the full width of the rightofway of all streets and alleys proposed to be dedicated in accordance with plans and specifications approved by the city engineer the subdivider or developer shall grade the roadbeds in the street rightsofway to subgrade 68 surfacing a after the installation of all underground improvements as may be required the subdivider shall surface all roadways in streets and alleys in accordance with the provisions set forth in article vi of this chapter and in accordance with any other applicable rule regulation design or specification of this or any other ordinance any construction in existing surfaced roadways will require slurry backfill b no street pavement construction shall commence until after the backfill has settled where any underground installations have been made in the roadway the settlement may be accomplished by either mechanical compaction or by the combination of mechanical compaction and jetting or by using granular backfill 69  rep & recr #441  am # 720  curb and gutter a after the installation of all underground improvements the subdivider or developer shall construct concrete curbs and gutters if recommended by the public works committee and plan commission in accordance with plans and standard specifications approved by the city engineer b where curb and gutter installation is not required and is waived by the city council the subdivider or developer shall finish grade all shoulders and road ditches install all necessary culverts at intersections and if required surface ditch inverts to prevent erosion and sedimentation in accordance with plans and standard specifications approved by the city engineer 70  rep & recr #441  am # 720  sidewalks where required by the plan commission the subdivider or developer shall construct a sidewalk on one side of all frontage streets and both sides of all other streets within the subdivision and the construction of all sidewalks shall be in accordance with plans and specifications approved by the city engineer 71  rep & recr #441 sanitary sewers and sewer design a if public sewer facilities are not available the plan commission may require that the subdivider or developer make provisions for an adequate private sewage disposal system which shall be constructed according to all applicable laws rules and regulations and shall be made available to all lots in the subdivision b if public sewer facilities are available or the city engineer shall certify that they will within reasonable probability be available within five years from the date of filing the application for preliminary plat approval the subdivider or developer shall install sanitary sewers and laterals to the street lot line and shall cap and mark all laterals in the manner specified herein in all of the events covered by this subsection the following specifications for sanitary sewers shall be applicable 1 sanitary sewers shall be constructed and installed in accordance with the standard specifications for sewer and water construction in wisconsin latest edition hereinafter referred to as standard specifications and in accordance with wis admin nr 110 2 manholes shall be as specified in standard specifications except that brick manholes shall not be allowed 3 manhole frames shall be neenah r1660 or equal covers shall have machined bearing surfaces and a nonrocking lid with concealed pick holes and no vent holes gasketed covers may be required in certain areas at the direction of the city engineer 4 sanitary sewers shall be located in the center of the street rightofway unless otherwise approved by the city engineer 5 sanitary sewer laterals shall be installed to the lot line or street rightofway line the ends of the sanitary laterals at the rightofway or lot lines shall be properly marked with a six feet long by two inches by six inches plank a sixfootlong by oneinch diameter steel reinforcing rod or some other method approved by the city engineer fourinch or sixinch sanitary sewer laterals may be installed the materials and construction shall conform to standard specifications and wis admin h62 6 if larger diameter sanitary sewers are required to service areas outside the proposed development the cost of such oversizing shall be prorated in proportion to the ratio which the total area of the proposed development is to the total service area to be served by such larger sewer and the excess cost shall be borne either by the city or assessed against the total tributary service area excluding the proposed development public sanitary sewers shall be a minimum of eightinch diameter per state code 7 when small diameter pressure systems are required to provide service the developer shall provide adequate plans and specifications for the proposed system and equipment to the city engineer for approval this shall include but not be limited to the following a plans and specifications of piping system showing proposed locations and elevations of the pumping units and discharge points b operation and maintenance manuals including 1 manufacturers name and performance data of the proposed pumping units 2 information on availability of repair parts and maintenance service for the proposed pumping units c the systems shall be designed for outdoor installation of the pumps all alarms and controls associated with the pumping units shall be mounted in close proximity to the units and be readily accessible to maintenance personnel d the complete pumping unit including motor must be designed to operate in a submerged condition the units shall be capable of reducing all solids normally found in sewage and then pumping the resulting slurry pressure service pipe to the pressure or gravity sewer system e all curb stops on a pressure line shall have curb stop extension rods in place a minimum of 18 inches from the top of the cover the stationary rod shall be pinned onto the operating end of the curb stop f all new sanitary sewers shall be cleaned and videotaped with true copy of tape given to city prior to final acceptance 72  rep & recr #441  cr #515 stormwater drainage facilities a stormwater sewering or surface drainage systems shall be provided adequately serve the area being platted considering but not limited to the following 1 the design of the drainage system shall consider and show the following a storm drainage area of which the subdivision is a part b detailed calculations as to volume of stormwater generated and method of storage and conveyance c a stormwater system sufficient in size to eliminate flooding or ponding of water consisting of culverts ditches storm sewers retention basins etc 2 where storm sewers can practically be installed and where the city engineer concludes that storm sewers will be necessary to control erosion or ponding such storm sewers shall be designed in accordance with the following minimum specifications a general all stormwater detention facilities shall be designed to restrict postdevelopment flow rates to meet the following multiple storm conditions a tenyear postdevelopment conditions flow rate to discharge at no more than a twoyear predeveloped flow rate a 100year postdeveloped conditions flow rate to discharge at no more than a tenyear predeveloped flow rate all stormwater detention basins will be required to serve as temporary sedimentation facilities during the construction phase of the development the sediment basin shall be designed per the state of wisconsin construction site best management practice handbook to include a minimum of two feet of sediment storage below the dewatering holes and a riser pipes with trash guards all riser pipes and initial stone layer shall be wrapped with filter fabric and protected with six inches of clean stone riprap at the end of construction when the area has been fully restored the riser pipes shall be removed and the sedimentation storage area filled and restored to the detention basin final grades 1 dry detention basins all dry detention basins shall be designed with maximum  sideslopes all basins require emergency overflow spillways that can accommodate the 100year developed conditions storm the spillway shall be set at an elevation that provides a minimum of one foot of freeboard above the peak state elevation of the 100year postdeveloped conditions storm 2 wet detention basins all wet detention basins shall be designed with a maximum  sideslope leading to the waters edge the wet basin shall then include a safety shelf at a maximum  slope for a minimum of six feet in width the wet basin may then drop at a maximum  sideslope until a maximum normal water depth of eight feet all wet detention basins must include an emergency spillway as outlined above b storm sewers shall be designed in such way as to insure a minimum velocity of flow of two feet per second c manholes shall be provided at all changes in direction of pipe and pipe size and shall be of the type specified in standard specifications or the standard specifications of the city inlets shall be located not more than 500 feet apart and shall be the type specified in standard specifications or the standard specifications of the city d all new storm sewers shall be cleaned and videotaped with true copy of tape given to the city prior to final acceptance 3 where ditches are utilized for storm drainage they shall meet the following minimum standards a culverts at all street or driveway intersections sized to eliminate flooding or ponding of water b driveway culverts shall be arch pipe no less than 15 inches in diameter equivalent with metal flared end sections b all storm drainage facilities shall be so designed as to present no hazard to life or property and shall be designed with due consideration to aesthetic values c if storm sewers of greater than 36inch diameter are required to handle the contemplated flows the cost of such larger sewers shall be prorated in proportion to the ratio which the total area of the proposed plat is to the total drainage area to be served by such larger sewer and the excess cost shall be borne either by the city or assessed against the total tributary drainage area d all work must be in compliance with section 4213 relating to erosion control 73  rep & recr #441  cr #515  am # 720  water supply and water distribution a water supply 1 water supply and water distribution systems shall be designed to furnish water in the quantity required by the state of wisconsin requirements for domestic water supply and also in accordance with the national board of underwriters for fire demand 2 sufficient storage shall be designed and constructed to provide a reserve supply in accordance with the requirements of the state of wisconsin and national board of underwriters 3 the city shall have the right to furnish water meters of the design specified by the city engineer 4 if the city operates or supervises the operation of any water supply system it shall have the right to make an appropriate service charge therefore and the right to make such charge shall be stated both in the recorded plat and in all deeds to property embraced in such plat b water distribution 1 all work shall be done in accordance with the provisions standard specifications for sewer and water construction in wisconsin latest edition and state of wisconsin department of transportation division of highways and transportation services standard specifications for highway and structure construction latest edition including all supplemental specifications and other revisions to date unless otherwise specified herein or on the plans both documents are referred to herein as standard specifications 2 no public water main shall be installed of less than eight inches in diameter but if greater than such diameter water mains are required the excess cost of such mains over and above the cost of an eightinch main shall be borne by the subdivider or developer 3 water mains shall be class 52 ductile iron conforming to awwa c151 cement lined in accordance with awwa c104 with polyethylene wrap class 150 pvc pressure pipe per awwa c900 may be used subject to city approval 4 fittings shall be ductile iron conforming to the requirements of awwa c110 all fittings should have a minimum working pressure rating of 250 psi 5 fire hydrants with auxiliary valves shall be provided in accordance with the recommendations of the national board of underwriters but in no case shall the spacing of said fire hydrants be greater than 500 feet fire hydrants shall be awwa traffictype with breakoff couplings waterouspacer wb67 with sixinch inlet and 5inch valve opening one 4inch pumper nozzle and two 2inch hose nozzles all hydrants shall have a red barrel and bonnet with white caps the paint shall be reflective type paint a fiberglass marker wand approved by the city shall be installed on the breakaway flange of each hydrant 6 fire hydrants shall be vandalproofed a vandalproof device shall be installed on all fire hydrants by the city of delafield water department the cost of installation of the vandalproof device including parts and labor shall be billed to the developer the vandalproof device shall be approved by the city of delafield fire chief and the city of delafield water department the device shall be attached to the fire hydrant housing or opening mechanism per manufacturers specifications all materials used shall be strong enough to withstand acts of vandalism and weather extremes and still provide smooth hydrant operation an innerbarrel construction of high tensile manganese bronze shall be designed to fit over the fire hydrant operating nut an outer housing constructed of stainless steel shall be installed over the inner barrel so as to swivel freely until a special key wrench is used attachment of the outer housing shall be by a special snap ring groove designed to withstand repeated blows by sledge hammers without shearing a mating collar shall be installed between the outer housing hydrant top for a weather seal and to prevent removal of the swivel housing the mating collar shall extend up the sides of the swivel housing to a height sufficient to provide added protection for the hydrant operating nut and to resist repeated blows by sledge hammers a special key wrench shall be constructed of an aluminum magnesium alloy with handles extending from both sides for easy operation the wrench shall incorporate a unique permanent magnet which will engage an activator located inside the outer housing the special key wrench will be the only means of opening or closing the hydrant the opposite side of the key wrench shall contain a conventional pentagon recess that will work on standard hydrants performance of the vandalproof system must not be affected by local environmental temperature ranges or weather conditions 7 valves shall be provided in such locations to allow the shutting down of not more than 1000foot linear pipe gate valves shall conform to awwa c500 valves eight inches and smaller shall have a clow 3piece valve box f2450 complete with f2494 cover valves 12 inches and larger require a fivefoot diameter manhole complete with neenah cover r1900d lettered water any substitution of an approved equal will require city approval 8 water service lines to be extended to lot line and to be oneinch diameter minimum continuous from main to lot line type k astm b88 corporation stops to be mueller h1500 for threequarterinch to 1inch lines and ford fb600 for 1inch to twoinch lines curb stops to be mueller h15154 curb boxes to be mueller h10302 curb stops shall have a stationary rod in place which is a minimum of 18 inches from the top cover the stationary rod shall be pinned onto the operating end of the curb stop valve boxes shall have a valve box extension stem in place which is a minimum of 18 inches from the top of the cover the valve box extension stem shall be fastened to the operating end of the valve equals subject to approval by city 9 all water mains shall be installed with a blue threeinchwide warning tape located over the main and 12inches below finished grade said tape shall read caution  water line buried below 10 all water main and facilities shall be installed with a detector wire consisting of an insulated aws #12 copper wire taped to the main in addition a wrap four feet of extra wire around beginning and end of main  b wrap each valve including hydrant valves to below operating nut flange  and c wrap each valve box to within two inches of top ending in a loop a satisfactory conductivity test shall be performed prior to acceptance of system c miscellaneous where a water supply system is not available or is not required under the terms of this chapter individual sources of water supply shall be permitted provided that all requirements of the city and the state of wisconsin are fully complied with but in all such cases restrictions shall be filed with the final plat and incorporated in each deed to parcels in the subdivision which shall provide that each private owner of such parcel shall bear his fair proportionate share of the cost of any future public water main as determined by agreement or special assessment proceeding or other means authorized by law to finance construction of water systems 74  rep & recr #441  cr #457  am #505  am #515 other utilities a the subdivider or developer shall cause gas electric and telephone facilities to be installed in such manner as to make adequate service available to each lot in the subdivision b all electric and telephone cables shall be buried underground in accordance with the specifications of the state electrical code and this shall include feeder cables and individual service connections c plans indicating the proposed location of all gas electric and telephone distribution and transmission lines required to service the plat shall be approved by the city engineer 75  rep & recr #441 street lamps a if requested by the public works committee and required by council the subdivider or developer shall install or cause to be installed street lamps along all streets proposed to be dedicated of a design compatible with neighborhood and the type of development proposed such design to be approved by the plan commission b such lamps shall be placed or caused to be placed at each street intersection and at such interior block spacing as may be required by the public works committee 76  rep & recr #441 street signs the department of public works shall install a street sign of a design approved by the plan commission at the intersection of all streets proposed to be dedicated and such signs shall where possible conform to the design of signs elsewhere in the city costs shall be paid by the developer 77  rep & recr #441 guard rails guard rails shall be placed along the shoulder of any street where street construction has resulted in an embankment higher than six inches measured vertically 78  rep & recr #441 street trees sodding cleanup and the like a the subdivider or developer shall pay to the city the sum of $10000 per lot of the proposed subdivision to be used for tree plantings or planting screens in the city see subsection b of this section for definition of planting screens payment under this subsection shall be made prior to final plat approval b planting screens in some circumstances the plan commission may require a planting screen buffer between conflicting or contrasting land uses andor to provide visual and sound screening along highways and major roads such planting shall be placed within a designated planting easement of adequate width and shall conform to plans required as part of the preliminary plat submittal and in accuracy and detail sufficient for review by the plan commission the following general guidelines shall apply 1 planting screens shall consist of compatible naturalistic groupings of hardy native plant material 2 a diverse mixture of deciduous and evergreen tree and shrub varieties shall be used 3 monotonous straightrow plantings of identical or similar material will not be accepted 4 sizes shall be adequate for reasonable immediate effect 5 shortlived softwood tree varieties are not acceptable ie silver maple lombardy poplar box elder chinese elm c wherever possible existing trees shall be preserved in the installation of subdivision improvements all street rightofway which is not paved shall be seeded or sodded provisions shall be made to assure the growth of all landscaping d all stripped areas shall be seeded and all destroyed trees brush debris and rubbish removed all cut and filled sections throughout the subdivision are to be developed and returfed in a manner satisfactory to the city engineer 1 developer shall comply with requirements of chapter 52 of this to erosion control 2 bond requirements for other improvements in the subdivision shall apply to this section 79  rep & recr #441 erosion controls erosion controls approved by the city engineer must be in place inspected and approved prior to issuance of any building permits or granting a permit for preliminary grading or site preparation 80  rep & recr #441  am # 720  fire protection water supply in areas not served by a municipal water supply and distribution system subdividers or developers shall provide onsite storage tanks of sufficient size to provide an adequate supply of water for the purpose of controlling fires the size of the onsite water storage tank shall be determined by the fire chief based on the guidelines of the state of wisconsin and the national fire protection association where in the opinion of the plan commission the fire protection needs of the subdivision can be better met by use of a tanker vehicle the subdivider or developer may be allowed to pay a fee equivalent to the cost of an installed onsite water storage tank to the city in lieu of providing onsite water storage any funds received by the city under the provision of this section shall be used exclusively for the purchase and maintenance of a water tanker vehicle 81  rep & recr #441 final construction plans final construction plans shall be prepared on 22inch by 36inch paper or mylar film and shall contain at least the following information in the following order 1 title page 2 plat of subdivision 3 general layout drawings of the proposed streets 4 general layout drawings of the proposed water system if any 5 general layout drawings of the proposed sanitary sewers if any 6 general layout drawings of the proposed storm drainage 7 plans and profiles of streets and sewers with a scale of not less than one inch to 50 feet horizontal and one inch to five feet vertical 8 details of structures and other improvements required to be installed in the subdivision 82  rep & recr #441 material standardsgeneral a all construction of improvements covered by this chapter shall be in accordance with and materials used shall be in compliance with the methods and materials required in the appropriate sections of standard specifications as amended published by the division of highways state of wisconsin b the following construction materials shall conform to the public works industry improvement program minimum indicated 1 standard strength clay sewer pipe astm c1350t as revised 2 extra strength clay pipe astm c20050t as revised 3 concrete sewer pipe astm c76 astm c14 4 corrugated metal pipe aashto designation m36 5 concrete masonry astm c139 as revised 6 building brick astm c62 grade sw as revised 7 concrete building brick astm c55 grade a as revised 8 cast iron water pipe astm class 150 9 cast iron sewer pipe astm class 100 10 frames and grates city standards 11 pvc astm d3034 and f679 12 other materials city standards and other materials as detailed in standard specifications andor approved by the city 83  rep & recr #441 material standardsasphalt pavements a asphalt roadway surface the developer and contractor shall install a minimum of four inches of hot mix asphalt hma in two lifts with compaction per the latest version of the wisconsin department of transportation standard specifications for highway and structure construction tack coat will be installed between lifts of asphalt the city engineer may require a thicker asphalt section for collector or nonresidential applications traffic controls and barricades must be installed and maintained per the manual on uniform traffic control devices mutcd the city will require submittal of asphalt mix designs prior to paving the city engineer will require the contractor to submit load tickets for asphalt yield computations and submit nuclear density test results for asphalt density verification b slopes and ditches  planting  grass cover side slopes and ditches along roads or in easements shall be covered with topsoil prepared seeded or sodded fertilized and maintained for a sufficient period to provide adequate grass cover prior to acceptance by the city council the city may require erosion control matting or turf reinforcement matting to stabilize slopes as necessary the developers engineer shall provide the seed mix for approval c signs  posts and guardrails street signs roadway striping culvert posts and guardrails as required by the city council shall be obtained and placed by the city the cost of which shall be paid by the developer or owner d acceptance by the city roads will not be accepted by the city before may 1 or after november 1 acceptance of the roads does not relieve the developer of responsibility relative to adequate grass cover on the side slopes or in ditches 84  rep & recr #441  rep & recr # 720  completion of improvements all of the improvements required under this chapter shall be constructed in accordance with the applicable provisions of this chapter and with all other standards rules and regulations which are now or may hereafter be adopted by the city council all improvements shall be completed prior to the final approval of the plat by the city council except that in lieu of the completion of construction a certified check surety bond or letter of credit approved by the city attorney may be furnished as provided in section 4416 85  rep & recr #441 guarantee of material and workmanship a the subdivider or developer shall provide a guarantee bond running to the city in the amount of 20 percent of the cost of improvements either actual or estimated such bond to be for a period of one year after final completion of construction b the city engineer shall certify to the city council the correctness of the amount of the bond and the date for final completion of all work guaranteed by such bond 86  rep & recr #441 as built plans a after completion of all public improvements and prior to final acceptance of such improvements the subdivider or developer shall make or cause to be made a map showing the actual location of all valves manholes tubs sewer and water mains and such other facilities as the engineer shall require b this map shall be in black ink and shall bear the signature and seal of a professional engineer registered in wisconsin additionally the same shall be submitted to the city clerktreasurer digital ie pdf format c the presentation of this map shall be a condition of final acceptance of the improvements and release of the surety bond assuring their completion 87  rep & recr #441  am # 720  secs 4423944269  reserved article viii  fees general the subdivider or developer shall pay the city all fees as hereinafter required and at the times specified the city shall be under no obligation to process any part or portion of any application for subdivision unless and until the appropriate fees as herein provided shall have been paid 90  rep & recr #441 preliminary plat review fee a at the time of first application for approval of any preliminary plat and in order to assist in defraying the cost of review the subdivider shall pay a fee according to the following schedule which fee shall be paid to the city treasurer up to and including 20 acres $25000 over 20 acres $25000 plus $200 per acre b a reapplication fee amounting to $1500 shall be paid to the city treasurer at the time of a reapplication for approval of any preliminary plat which has previously been reviewed 91  rep & recr #441  rep & recr # 720  improvement review fee a the subdivider or developer shall pay a fee equal to one percent of the cost of the required public improvements as estimated by the city engineer at the time of submission of improvement plans and specifications partially to cover the cost to the city of checking and reviewing such plans and specifications b a reapplication fee equal to the initial application fee shall be paid to the city treasurer at the time of a reapplication for approval of any preliminary plat which has previously been reviewed 92  rep & recr #441  am # 720  inspection fee the subdivider or developer shall pay a fee equal to the actual cost to the city for such inspection as the city engineer deems necessary to assure that the construction of the required improvements is in compliance with the plans specifications and ordinances of the city and any other governmental authority 93  rep & recr #441 final plat review fee a the subdivider shall pay a fee to the city treasurer at the time of first application for approval of such plat in order to assist in defraying the cost of review such fee shall be determined as follows 1 up to and including 20 acres $19000 2 over 20 acres $19000 plus $200 per acre b a reapplication fee equal to the initial application fee assessed in subsection a of this section shall be paid to the city treasurer at the time of a reapplication for approval of any final plat which has previously been reviewed 94  rep & recr #441  rec & recr # 720  engineering fees a the subdivider or developer shall pay a fee equal to the actual cost to the city for all engineering work incurred by the city in connection with the plat engineering work shall include the preparation of construction plans and standard specifications fees for engineering work as herein referred to shall be in addition to those fees for inspection checking and reviewing as provided in sections 44272 and 44273 b see section 4417 for bonding requirements 96  rep & recr #441 administrative and legal fee the subdivider or developer shall pay a fee equal to the cost of any legal administrative or fiscal work which may be undertaken by the city in connection with the plat and legal work shall include among other things the drafting of contracts between the city and the subdivider or developer 97  rep & recr #441 recording fees the subdivider or developer shall pay any and all recording fees required by this chapter in advance of recording 98  rep & recr #441 taxation preparation of tax roll and tax collection a preparation pursuant to wis stats  70652 the clerktreasurer and finance officerbudget analyst shall prepare the tax roll and transfer it to the county treasurer on or before the third monday in december the clerktreasurer and finance officerbudget analyst shall furnish a tax roll certificate for taxes levied to the county treasurer per wis stats  70653 on or before the third monday in december b treasurers responsible for collection pursuant to wis stats  7407 the county treasurer shall collect the general property taxes special assessments special taxes and special charges shown in the tax roll c dates for payment of taxes special assessments and special charges 1 all real estate and personal property taxes special assessments special charges and other taxes shall be paid as provided in wis stats  7411 a all taxes on real property and on improvements on leased land shall be paid in one of the following ways 1 in full on or before january 31 2 in two equal installments unless subject to subsection c1d of this section with the first installment payable on or before january 31 and the second installment payable on or before july 31 b all special assessments special charges and special taxes that are placed in the tax roll shall be paid in full on or before january 31 c all taxes on personal property except those on improvements on leased land shall be paid in full on or five working days after january 31 d if the total real property tax levied on a parcel of property is less than $10000 or if the total property tax levied on an improvement on leased land is less than $10000 it shall be paid in full on or before january 31 e payments 1 payments made on or before january 31 shall be made to the county treasurer 2 personal property payments shall be made to the city clerktreasurer after january 31 3 all other payments shall be made to the county treasurer 01  am #373  rep & recr # 696  special assessments a payment in installments 1 whenever any special assessments shall be levied to defray the cost of any public improvement such special assessments may be paid in annual installments of not more than ten in number as determined by the city council 2 the first installment shall include a proportionate part of the principal of the special assessment determined by the number of installments together with interest at the rate determined by the city council such interest rate shall be computed for a period of one year from the date of the notice hereinafter provided for and each subsequent installment shall include a like proportion of the principal and one years interest upon the unpaid portion of such assessment 3 the first installment shall be entered in the first tax roll prepared after the installments shall have been determined as a special tax on the property upon which the special assessment was levied and thereafter this tax shall be treated in all respects as any other city tax one of the subsequent installments shall be entered in a like manner and with like effect in each of the annual tax rolls thereafter until all are levied 4 if any installment so entered in the tax roll shall not be paid to the city treasurer with the other taxes it shall be returned to the county as delinquent and accepted and collected by the county in the same manner as delinquent general taxes on real estate b deferred assessments 1 the city council has made the following finding in the interest of the public health welfare and safety it is often necessary to construct certain public improvements in areas which are undeveloped or outside the territorial limits of the city 2 the city council may defer the due date of any special assessment levied against property abutting or benefited by a public improvement which abutting property is undeveloped or outside the territorial limits of the city such special assessment must be paid however within ten years of the date of the resolution making the levy unless the city council permits additional time by allowing payment of the assessment in installments in which case the assessments shall be paid within the time prescribed by the resolution permitting installment payments 3 if the city council defers the due date of special assessments under this section it shall make an annual interest charge the rate thereof to be set by the city council which charge shall be added to the total assessment for each full year of deferment 4 owners of property for which a special assessment has been deferred under this section shall not have use of the improvement until a the amount of the deferred assessment including interest due thereon is paid in full to the city  or b such an owner desiring to make use of the improvement shall enter into an agreement with the city to pay the assessment plus accrued interest plus future interest over a stipulated period of time in equal installments of principal plus variable installments of interest as determined by the city council except that where approved by the city council only that portion of the total amount of deferred assessment shall be collected as it applies to the portion of the land being developed 5 any special assessment deferred under this section shall be a lien against the property assessed from the date of the resolution making the levy 6 whenever the due date of a special assessment shall be deferred under this section a notice shall be published in the official paper substantially as follows deferred assessment notice notice is hereby given that the special assessments for improvement of describe the improvement have been determined as to each parcel of real estate affected thereby and a statement of the same is on file with the city clerktreasurer it is proposed to defer payment of the same with interest thereon here insert the percent per annum c wis stats ch 66 adopted the provisions of the wisconsin statutes relating to street improvements laying of sanitary sewers water mains stormwater sewers paving and any other public improvement and providing for the costs of installing and constructing the same and the manner of levying special assessments against the property benefited thereby are hereby adopted for the city and shall be in force and effect as ordinances of the city as if fully set forth herein except that wherever such statute provides for the giving of notice in addition to the posting and publication of notice as provided in the statutes personal notice shall be given by mailing such notice to each interested person whose post office address is known or can with reasonable diligence be ascertained at least ten days before the hearing or proceeding specified in the notice d alternate procedure 1 in addition to other methods provided by law special assessments for any public work or improvement or any current service may be levied in accordance with the provisions of this subsection d 2 whenever the city council shall determine that any public work or improvement or any current service shall be financed in whole or in part by special assessments levied under this section it shall adopt a resolution specifying this intention and the time either before or after completion of the work or improvement when the amount of the assessments will be determined and levied the number of annual installments if any in which assessments may be paid the rate of interest to be charged on the unpaid balance and the terms on which any of the assessments may be deferred while no use of the improvement is made in connection with the property 3 the provisions of wis stats   shall apply to special assessments levied under this section except that when the city council determines by resolution that the hearing on the assessments be held subsequent to the completion of the work or improvement or the rendering of the service the report required by wis stats  4 shall contain a statement of the final cost of the work service or improvement in lieu of an estimate of the cost 4 notice of the time and place of the public hearing on any special assessment proposed to be levied and notice of the final assessment and terms of payment thereof shall be given in the manner prescribed by wis stats  10 and subsection c of this section 5 any special assessment levied under this section shall be a lien against the property assessed from the date of the final resolution of the city council determining the amount of the levy 6 any person against whose property a special assessment is levied under this section may appeal therefrom in the manner prescribed by wis stats  12 within 40 days of the date of the final determination of the city council 10  cr #126  cr #178  rep & recr #696  room tax rates  commission created a purpose pursuant to wis stats   for the privilege of furnishing at retail rooms or lodging to transients by hotel keepers motel operators and other persons furnishing accommodations that are available to the public irrespective of whether membership is required for use of the accommodations a room tax is hereby imposed upon retailers at the rate of eight percent of the gross receipts for the lease or rental of such accommodations rooms or lodging within the city effective  b city promotion and tourism commission created a city promotion and tourism commission commission is hereby created the commission shall consist of six voting members and one city council representative serving in an ex officio capacity each member shall be appointed by the mayor and shall be confirmed by a majority vote of the common council who are present for the vote in addition the mayor shall appoint one alternate member of the commission who shall act with full power only when a member of the board refuses to vote because of interest or when a regular member is absent such alternate members shall be designated alternate any vacancy occurring on the commission shall be filled for the unexpired term of the member involved by appointment and confirmation as provided above commission members shall serve oneyear terms and may be reappointed members shall serve at the pleasure of the mayor the commission shall include a representative from the state hotel and motel industry the commission shall meet regularly and from among its members it shall elect a chairperson a vice chairperson and a secretary c definitions in this section transient hotel and motel have the meanings in wis stats  77522a1 d exempt from selective sales tax the room tax shall not be subject to the selective sales tax imposed by wis stats  77522a1 e reports each retailer engaged in furnishing such accommodations rooms or lodging as defined in this section shall submit a quarterly report to the treasurers office showing the gross receipts from furnishing such accommodations rooms or lodging and a copy of hisher state sales tax report for such business along with the effective percentage tax for the gross receipts as reported but not later than 30 days from the end of each calendar quarter for the receipts of that past calendar quarter f distribution and use of room tax room tax shall be collected by the city in accordance with this section and wis stats   the city shall retain the maximum amount of room tax allowed by state statute for general purposes and the remainder of the room tax shall be forwarded to the city promotion and tourism commission commission the commission shall use such funds for the purpose of tourism promotion and development as used herein the term tourism promotion and development means any of the following that are significantly used by transient tourists and reasonably likely to generate paid overnight stays at any establishment required to collect and remit to the city the room tax established by this section 1 marketing projects including advertising media buys creation and distribution of printed or electronic promotional tourist materials or efforts to recruit conventions sporting events or motor coach groups 2 transient tourist informational services 3 tangible municipal development including a convention center the commission shall submit to the city council annually a detailed report of the amount of room tax revenues received by the commission and the purpose or purposes for which the revenues were spent the report shall include such information as may be required by the city from time to time so as to allow the city to submit all reports and information necessary to complete and submit timely filings required by the department of revenue or any other state agency charged with the responsibility of administering and regulating the collection and use of room tax revenues g unpaid taxes all unpaid taxes shall bear interest at the rate of 1 percent per month from the due date of the return failure to pay the tax or delinquent payment of such taxes shall be subject to a $5000 late filing penalty in addition to the interest imposed by this section h liability if any person liable for any amount of tax under this section sells hisher business or stock of goods or goods or quits the business his successors or assigns shall be responsible for unpaid tax due under this section i false or fraudulent return if a false or fraudulent return is filed with the intent in either case to defeat or evade the tax imposed by this section a penalty of 50 percent of the tax due shall be paid in addition to the tax interest and late filing penalty 12  cr #195  recr #424  am #572  #609  rep & recr #696   rep & rec 735    3 4 8202018 note a of this section was amended by #347  subsection e of this section was amended by mcc 1995 impact fees  imposition and effective date of fees  effective  a fees generally the following fees shall be paid prior to issuance of a zoning or building permit for any single family residential structure any residential structure having in excess of one dwelling and any principal structure intended or capable of human occupancy for nonresidential purposes the amount of fee and the categories of public facilities for which the fee is created shall be adopted from time to time by the council and kept on file by the city clerktreasurer b adjustments 1 impact fees shall be reviewed annually to determine adjustments deemed necessary by the common council to reflect changes in the net capital value of facilities and changes in the municipal debt and any other relevant change of circumstances the date for review shall be correlated to the issuance of the annual statement of values as part of the state of wisconsin local government property insurance fund program all changes in impact fees shall be in effect as adopted by ordinance 2 in response to specific applications the common council may provide an exception from or the reduction in the amount of impact fees on land development that provides lowcost housing provided that the impact fee reduction or exemption does not result in increasing fees to other properties that are subject to the fees c treatment of impact fee revenues 1 impact fees collected pursuant to this section shall be accounted for separately from other funds of the city impact fee revenues and interest earned on impact fee revenues may be expended only for the capital facilities for which the impact fees were collected 2 impact fees that are collected pursuant to this section but are not used within a reasonable length of time after they are collected to fund the capital facility costs for which they are collected shall be refunded to the thencurrent owner of the property with respect to which the impact fees were collected the time periods indicated below are deemed by the city to constitute reasonable periods of time within which the fees that are collected may be retained by the city and used for the purposes for which they are collected capital facility time period from date of collection within which funds will be available for the specified use by the city library facilities 10 years law enforcement facilities 10 years fire protection facilities 10 years recreation facilities 10 years recycling facilities 10 years d appeals property owners or other parties who are aggrieved by the imposition of an impact fee or fees pursuant to this section may file an appeal of the amount of the impact fee the collection or use of the impact fee the form of appeal shall be a written narrative stating the nature and reasons for the appeal and filed with the city clerktreasurer the appeal shall be noticed on the agenda of the next meeting of the common council and referred to those boards committees commissions departments and advisors deemed necessary by the common council following receipt of reports from said committees the common council shall provide an opportunity for the appellant to address the council following this the council shall determine whether or not to sustain the appeal in whole or in part and shall grant relief appropriate to the circumstances 13  cr #466  am #645  #672  rep & recr #696  traffic and vehicles state traffic laws adopted except as otherwise specifically provided in this the statutory provisions of wis stats chs 340 to 348 and  94101 describing and defining regulations with respect to vehicles and traffic exclusive of any provisions therein relating to penalties to be imposed are hereby adopted and by reference made a part of this chapter as if fully set forth herein any act required to be performed or prohibited by any statute incorporated herein by reference is required or prohibited by this section any future amendments revisions or modifications of the statutes incorporated herein are intended to be made part of this chapter in order to secure uniform statewide regulation of traffic on the highways streets and alleys of the state 01  rep & recr # 699  state standards for motor vehicle equipment adopted a administrative regulations adopted the administrative rules and regulations of wis admin trans 305 exclusive of any provisions therein relating to the penalties to be imposed are hereby adopted by reference and made part of this if fully set forth herein b limitation a law enforcement officer may not stop or inspect a vehicle solely to determine compliance with wis admin trans 305 a law enforcement officer may issue a citation for a violation of wis admin trans 305 observed in the course of a stop or inspection made for other
